[[Ezra Weisz]] (English) [[Season 2|S2]]) |2 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Alan Velázquez|Alan Velázquez]] (Latin American Spanish [[Season 1|S1]]) |3 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Mark Pokora|Mark Pokora]] (Latin American Spanish [[Season 2|S2]]) |4 = Michael Ernst (German) |5 = Fehér Tibor (Hungarian) |6 = [[Wikipedia:Franck Tordjman|Franck Tordjman]] (French)
[[Wikipedia:Martial Le Minoux|Martial Le Minoux]] (Second voice, French) |7 = Jakub Nemčok (Czech, as Copycat) |8 = Tomoyuki Maruyama (Japanese)https://twitter.com/souyakazuki_/status/1007498601516318722 |9 = Nemanja Živković (Serbian, in [[Copycat]]) |10 = Lako Nikolić (Serbian, in [[Guitar Villain]]) |11 = Onur Akgülgil (Turkish) }} |latest = [[The Puppeteer 2]] |affiliations={{HideSpoiler|[[Musée Grévin]]}}}} {{Quote|The very thought of it makes me purr!|Théo|"[[Copycat]]"|quotelink = yes}} {{SpoilerButton}} '''{{PAGENAME}}'''http://metawohoo.tumblr.com/post/148541108709/i-got-my-copy-of-un-chat-de-trop-and-the-actual is an artist and a sculptor. In "[[Copycat]]", when [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] doesn't attend the unveiling of his [[Ladybug's and Cat Noir's sculpture|statue]] of her and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]], he becomes frustrated. When Cat Noir claims to "have a thing" with Ladybug, Théo also becomes jealous and gets [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into Copycat, a doppelganger of Cat Noir. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Théo is a bit taller than Adrien, with brown hair tied up in a bun, brown eyes, and a soul patch. === Civilian attire === He wears a purple shirt with two unbuttoned buttons at the top, a black overshirt, gray jeans, and black boots. === As Copycat === Copycat looks the exact same as Cat Noir, including his physical features. == Personality == Théo is creative and gracious. He appreciates Ladybug for protecting Paris; he's sure they have a lot in common. Though more on the quiet side, he has a lot of passion for his work and the things he cares about. He has feelings for Ladybug and he takes it hard when she doesn't show up for the reveal of his statue. He also gets easily jealous when Cat Noir brags about he and Ladybug being a couple, claiming that Cat Noir isn't good enough for her. However, after he is reverted back to his normal self, he gets over his frustration and jealousy, appreciating Ladybug signing his photo of her and at peace about Cat Noir and Ladybug being together--not knowing that it isn't the case. As Copycat, he is overcome by his jealousy of Cat Noir and admiration of Ladybug. He makes a bad name for Cat Noir by stealing the Mona Lisa from the Louvre and he captures Cat Noir and attempts to trick Ladybug into thinking that he is the real Cat Noir, in hopes of achieving her affection. When he isn't able to fool Ladybug, he shouts that no one will have her and attacks Cat Noir. While cunning and determined, he falls for Ladybug's trick of asking him about their secret promise that they never made, which he thinks they have. == Abilities == === As a civilian === [[File:CC (139).png|thumb|left|Théo's statue of Ladybug and Cat Noir.]] Théo is a very skilled artist, being able to make a very realistic bronze statue of Ladybug and Cat Noir (although, according to the latter, he should be taller). Also, Théo is able to do a wide variety of jobs, such as being a furniture mover and a boom operator, as seen in multiple cameos. === As Copycat === CC (405).png|Copycat hiding his photo, where the akuma hides, in his pocket. CC (496).png|Copycat fighting with Ladybug. CC (459).png|Copycat using his Cataclysm. CC (525).png|Copycat's ring, losing a pad after using Cataclysm. Copycat, being [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir's]] doppelganger, possesses supernatural strength and agility, along with having a copy of Cat Noir's [[staff]] and being able to use [[Cataclysm]]. However, using Cataclysm makes him start running out of energy, which is shown by his ring losing paw prints, just as it does for the real Cat Noir. He can also mimic Cat Noir's voice. {{Clear}} == Relationships == === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] === Théo has a crush on Ladybug, inspired by her heroism and admiring her greatly. However, he is upset when Ladybug doesn't show up to the reveal of the statue he designed, and he becomes determined to win her over after becoming akumatized as Copycat. He attempts to trick Ladybug into thinking he is Cat Noir, but his trickery is figured out, and, upset that Ladybug won't take him over the real Cat Noir, he declares that if he can't have her, no one will. After he is returned to normal, Théo is happy by Ladybug's compliments on his statue and accepts her apology. Also recovering from his heartbreak, he admits he has come to peace about her and Cat Noir's relationship, not knowing that it was a lie. === [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] === Théo appreciates Cat Noir's work for Paris, but he becomes jealous and disgusted of him when Cat Noir lies that he and Ladybug are close. While being Copycat, he seeks revenge on Cat Noir by framing him for a crime and stealing his place as Ladybug's lover. Later, no longer Copycat, Théo gets over his crush on Ladybug and accepts Cat Noir's relationship with Ladybug. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS1|OP=yes|CC=yes|DC=back|TM=yes|AM=back|GV=yes|PX=yes|KF=back}} {{AppearancesS2|GT=yes|SP=yes|SQ=back|QW=back}} {{AppearancesS3|GM2=yes|PC=yes|PT2=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|GF=yes}} {{AppearancesOther|HBD=p}} == Trivia == * In the French dubbed version, Théo's supervillain name is called L'Imposteur. * As Copycat, when he is imitating Cat Noir, he is voiced by [[Bryce Papenbrook]], the voice actor who actually portrays Adrien/Cat Noir. * He makes various brief cameo appearances doing random jobs: ** In "Dark Cupid", he is a furniture mover, helping to carry a large picture frame into [[Le Grand Paris]] for [[Chloé Bourgeois|Chloé]]. ** In "The Mime", he helps advertise the pantomime show by holding a sign. ** In "Animan", he is found in the bathroom of [[Collège Françoise Dupont]]. ** In "Pixelator", he becomes trapped in a photo with [[Mireille Caquet]], having been strolling down the [[Champs-Élysées]] with her. ** In "Guitar Villain", he works as a DJ for [[XY]]. ** In "Kung Food", he is a boom operator for the [[World's Greatest Chef contest]]. ** In "Gigantitan" and "Sapotis", he is a rickshaw driver for Marinette's date and other people. *** This also makes him the character with the most known jobs in the city. * Théo is one of three characters to be akumatized into a [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]] version of a Miraculous superhero, with the others being [[Lila Rossi|Lila]] and [[Chloé Bourgeois|Chloe]], but he is the only one to look exactly like the Miraculous superhero. * Unlike Volpina but like Antibug, Copycat can only use his power once, while Volpina can use it as many times as she wishes {{Gallery|image = CC (492).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Théo Barbot]] [[es:Théo Barbot]] [[fr:Théo Barbot]] [[ko:테오 바우보]] [[pl:Théo Barbot]] [[pt-br:Théo Barbot]] [[ru:Тео Барбо]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

[[File:OR-2 (598).png|thumb|250x250px|Ladybug releasing a swarm of purified butterflies.]] This is a list of '''minor animals'''. These are animals that have appeared in the [[Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir|television series]] or other forms of media related to the series with minor appearances, background appearances, or one notable appearance.
== Bear == A bear is in an exhibit at the zoo in [[Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes]]. When [[Otis Césaire|Otis]] is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] in "[[Animan]]", he releases the bear. While free, the bear uses a car as a back scratcher (a reference to the ''Jungle Book'') while its owner is trying to prop it up with a carjack.
== Butterflies == [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] owns a bunch of white butterflies that he turns into [[Akuma|akumas]]. When the akumas are purified by [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and become regular butterflies again, they don't return to Hawk Moth's [[Hawk Moth's lair|lair]], roaming free throughout [[Paris]].
== Catfish == Multiple catfish live in the [[Seine]]. In the ''[[Miraculous Adventures]]'' story "[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 2|Trash Krakken Part 1]]", after a [[Unnamed fisherman|fisherman]] is akumatized into the the [[Akumatized villains|villain]] Silurus, he gains the ability to control said catfish. One giant catfish lands with its mouth open onto [[Chloé Bourgeois|Chloé]], who complains she is being swallowed by a "too fresh piece of sushi."
== Cats == There are a couple instances where cats appear in the series.
=== Gray cats === [[File:SS (40).png|thumb|Marinette remembering saving a gray cat stuck in a tree.]] While Marinette as Ladybug is trying to record a new video for [[Alya Césaire|Alya]] with Alya's [[Alya's cellphone|cellphone]] in "[[The Mime]]", a gray cat comes by and knocks the placed cellphone into the garbage can below.
In "[[Simon Says]]", Marinette thinks back to when as Ladybug she saved a gray cat in a tree. [[Mr. Damocles]], in his persona of The Owl, tries to save another gray cat stuck in a tree in "[[The Dark Owl]]", but when the cat bites him, they both fall off the tree and Ladybug and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] catch them. === Black cat === A black cat only appears in the [[It's Ladybug|theme song]] when it runs in front of Marinette while she is running to [[Collège Françoise Dupont|school]], causing her to trip and fall.
== Crocodiles == [[Jagged Stone]] owns a crocodile named [[Fang]].
Another crocodile is in an exhibit at the zoo in Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. When Otis is akumatized into Animan, he releases the crocodile.
== Eagle == An eagle is in an exhibit at the zoo in Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. When Otis is akumatized into Animan, he releases the eagle.
== Elephant == [[File:AM-(324).png|left|thumb|Animan in front of the released zoo animals.]]An elephant is in an exhibit at the zoo in Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. When Otis is akumatized into Animan, he releases the elephant.
== Flamingos == A flock of flamingos fly over the [[Île aux Cygnes]] in the ''Miraculous Adventures'' story "The Trash Krakken Part 1".
== Giraffe == A giraffe is in an exhibit at the zoo in Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. When Otis is akumatized into Animan, he releases the giraffe, who snatches and eats a potted tree plant from someone's balcony while free.
== Gorillas == Three gorillas are in an exhibit at the zoo in Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. When Otis is akumatized into Animan, he releases the gorillas. During their time out of the cages, the gorillas mess around in the [[Métro]].
== Horses == [[File:Ladybug Christmas Special (555).png|thumb|The horses for Santa Claus' sleigh.]] [[Santa Claus]] owns two brown horses that pull his sleigh through the snowy streets of Paris in "[[A Christmas Special]]". When Santa is akumatized into Santa Claws, his horses are transformed into black reindeer.
== Ladybugs == A ladybug lands on the [[Valentine's Day card|Valentines' Day card]] that Marinette is writing for Adrien in "[[Dark Cupid]]", Alya calling it a good omen. When Adrien receives the card later, he doesn't know who it's from because Marinette forgot to sign it. Another ladybug lands on it, and Adrien assumes it means that the card is from Ladybug.
== Panther == [[File:AM-(228).png|left|thumb|The panther growling.]] A panther is a new addition to the zoo at the Ménagerie du Jardin des Plantes. In "Animan", [[Nino Lahiffe|Nino]] invites Marinette to go see the panther with him, and at the same time, [[Lê Chiến Kim|Kim]] and [[Max Kanté|Max]] come to view it. Kim mocks and belittles the panther, stressing out the panther and annoying the zookeeper, Otis. When Otis becomes Animan, he releases the panther.
In "[[The Puppeteer]]", the endcard shows Marinette and [[Manon Chamack|Manon]] looking at the panther while visiting the zoo. By "Syren", the zoo has another panther.
== Pigeons == Pigeons are a recurring species of bird in Paris. They have a lot of tiny notable appearances. <gallery type="slideshow" widths="240" crop="true"> MP (280).png|Mr. Pigeon with a flock of pigeons. The Mime 075.png|A pigeon (Jacques) mimicking Alya. RK (42).png| A pigeon blocking Juleka's face. Antibug (1150).png|Pigeons on Antibug's sword. VP (551).png|An illusion disappearing around a pigeon. </gallery> * [[Xavier Ramier]] cherishes pigeons, and he enjoys feeding a huge flock of them, even where it is illegal. The pigeons fall under his control when he is akumatized into Mr. Pigeon in the [[Mr. Pigeon|episode of the same name]], following his orders, spying for him, grouping together in different shapes, attacking enemies, and kidnapping police officers. However, the pigeons stop listening to him if they see available food. * One pigeon is watching Marinette, Alya, and [[Tikki]] on the balcony of Marinette's [[Marinette's room|room]] at the beginning of "The Mime". When Alya is confused about who Marinette is talking to when she returns, Marinette claims she was talking to the pigeon, calling it Jacques. * A pigeon blocks [[Juleka Couffaine]]'s face in a photo of her with [[Rose Lavillant]], as seen in "[[Reflekta]]". * A couple of pigeons perch on Antibug's sword after Cat Noir throws it and it gets stuck on the [[Eiffel Tower]] in "[[Antibug]]". * In "[[Volpina]]", some of [[Lila Rossi|Volpina]]'s illusions are ruined by pigeons. One pigeon is hit by the comet illusion, and another hits a piece of rubble of the falling building illusion. * In "[[Reverser]]" after Reverser hit Xavier Ramier with a paper airplane, Xavier's pigeons start fleeing from him.

{{Icons|Past Bee}} {{Youmay|the Bee Miraculous holder from ancient China|[[Chloé Bourgeois|Queen Bee]] or another [[Bee (disambiguation)|Bee]]}} {{Infobox character |only = [[The Collector]] |species = Human |occupation = Superhero |residence = Ancient China |friends = [[Pollen]] |wieldedmiraculous = bee |weapons = [[Spinning top]] |image = TC (742).png}} The '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]] who is featured in the [[Miraculous spellbook]] for the [[Bee Miraculous]]. When [[Pollen]] inhabited the Bee Miraculous, they transformed into a bee-themed superhero.<ref>[https://twitter.com/MiraculousKOR/status/893343866367037441 Clip released at Comic Con Seoul on August 4, 2017.] The clip has since been removed by the request of ZAG and SAMG Animation, as the poster revealed on [https://twitter.com/MiraculousKOR/status/893695499357704192 Twitter].</ref>
== Appearance == As depicted in the Miraculous spellbook, the Bee Miraculous holder appears to have black hair that was tied up. Around their head and neck was a yellow cloth, covering the top half of their face. They wore a black tunic with yellow short sleeves, yellow trousers that ended shortly before their knees, and black cloth around their lower legs. On both arms, they had black and yellow striped cuff bracelets, and around their waist was a yellow and black striped sash. There appears to be a black object attached to or hanging around their hip, and they wore black shoes.
== Abilities == The Bee Miraculous holder used the [[Spinning top]], as seen in the book illustration. And assuming that the past Bee Miraculous holder powers are the same as the recent Bee Miraculous holder (Chloé). She would have had enhanced skills such as speed, agility, and strength. She would also have the superpower [[Venom]], allowing her to paralyze her opponents.
== Sightings == {{AppearancesS2|TC=p}}
== Trivia == *''Nǚwángfēng'' (女王蜂) means "queen bee" in Chinese. * She is the earliest known out all the Queen Bees starting the legacy.

{{Icons|Past Peacock}} {{Youmay|the Peacock Miraculous holder from ancient China|another [[Peacock (disambiguation)|Peacock]]}} {{Infobox character |only = [[The Collector]] |species = Human |occupation = Superhero |residence = Ancient China |friends = [[Duusu]] |wieldedmiraculous = peacock |superpower = [[Amokization]] |weapons = [[Hand fan]] |image = Ancient Chinese Peacock.png |caption = Screenshot from a video shown at Comic Con Seoul 2017.}} The '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]] who is featured in the [[Miraculous spellbook]] for the [[Peacock Miraculous]]. When [[Duusu]] inhabited the Peacock Miraculous, they transformed into a peacock-themed superhero.<ref>[https://twitter.com/MiraculousKOR/status/893343866367037441 Clip released at Comic Con Seoul on August 4, 2017.] The clip has since been removed by the request of ZAG and SAMG Animation, as the poster revealed on [https://twitter.com/MiraculousKOR/status/893695499357704192 Twitter].</ref>
== Appearance == As depicted in the Miraculous spellbook, they appear to have worn dark blue clothes.
== Abilities == The Peacock Miraculous holder's abilities are unknown outside of their [[Miraculous tools|tool]] being a [[Hand fan|hand fan]].
If this past Peacock Miraculous holder had the same powers as the recent holder ([[Nathalie Sancoeur|Mayura]]), they had enhanced physical abilities and the Peacock Miraculous' special [[Amokization|superpower]].
== Sightings == {{AppearancesS2|TC=p}}
== Trivia == * ''Kǒngquè'' (孔雀) means "peacock" in Chinese. * This person is the earliest known out all the Mayuras starting the legacy.

{{Icons|Moth Related}} {{Infobox character |image = Light mask.png|Violet Scarlet Light Mask (By RedkingZombie).png|Scarlet Akumokization.png|With Amokization |caption = [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth's]] light mask, used to communicate with his akumatized victims. |first = [[The Bubbler]] |latest = {{Latest episode}} |aliases = Evilized villains |species = Varies |occupation = Retrieving [[Miraculouses]] |affiliations = [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]]
[[Akuma]] |enemies = [[French Miraculous superhero team]] |likes = Causing destruction and mayhem
Revenge |dislikes = Defeat
French Miraculous superhero team |weapons = [[List of akumatized objects|Akumatized objects]] (sometimes) }} {{Quote|And when it comes to luring superheroes, what could be better than creating supervillains?|[[Gabriel Agreste]]|"[[Ladybug & Cat Noir (Origins - Part 1)|Ladybug & Cat Noir]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''', also called '''evilized villains''', are people transformed into supervillains by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] with [[Akumatization]], the superpower of the [[Butterfly Miraculous]]. == Transformation == {{SpoilerButton}}[[File:TDO (426).png|thumb|left|Mr. Damocles being akumatized.]] Whenever a person has strong negative emotions, such as anger, frustration, jealousy, disappointment, humiliation or sadness, Hawk Moth senses it from his lair and charges a butterfly with dark power to form an [[akuma]]. The akuma then flies away from Hawk Moth's lair to where the person is, and possesses [[List of akumatized objects|an important object that belongs to the person]]. Immediately, Hawk Moth telepathically links up to the person in order to communicate, using a butterfly-shaped light mask that goes around his and victim's eyes. Also, in that moment, the area around the person's eyes darkens into a dark rust color. He then gives them a new name for their supervillain identity and explains to the person that he'll give them the ability to accomplish their goals, if in turn, the person will retrieve the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and [[Cat Miraculous]] from [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]]. [[File:Kim_corruption.gif|thumb|Kim being corrupted.]] When the person agrees, black and purple smoke appears from the possessed object and surrounds the person. Once it recedes, the victim has transformed into a supervillain. If Hawk Moth needs to telepathically talk with them again, his light mask will reappear on both Hawk Moth and the villain.[[File:SW (738).png|thumb|left|Hawk Moth speaks to his akumatized victim.]] As stated in "[[Robostus]]", any sentient creature with emotions can be akumatized. For example, the robot [[Markov]] is akumatized in the aforementioned episode, and infant [[August]] is akumatized in "[[Gigantitan]]". Sometimes, other living things or beings are indirectly transformed with the main victim, such as [[Fang]] changing into a dragon in "[[Guitar Villain]]" when [[Jagged Stone]] is akumatized, and [[Albert]] becoming a more advanced AI in "[[The Dark Owl]]" when [[Mr. Damocles]] is akumatized. Inanimate objects that are not the akumatized object can change because of the victim's akumatization, such as [[Roger Raincomprix]]'s car transforming in "[[Rogercop]]". While it is theoretically possible for someone with extreme willpower to resist or even overcome Hawk Moth's influence, only [[Caline Bustier|Miss Bustier]] has ever been shown doing so, and even she succumbed after approximately 30 seconds. In "[[Miraculer]]", [[Chloé Bourgeois]] is completely successful in refusing Hawk Moth's offer. == Abilities == [[File:MP (501).png|thumb|Mr. Pigeon communicating with a pigeon.]] An akumatized villain usually has an appearance and abilities that relate to their infected object, occupation, circumstances, and/or interests. For example, because of [[Xavier Ramier]]'s love of pigeons and his object being a pigeon call, he becomes Mr. Pigeon, a villain with a suit based off of pigeons and the ability to command pigeons. In whatever way they're changed, an akumatized villain usually has enhanced abilities and skills. A majority of the time, their objects end up becoming their weapons, such as [[Nino Lahiffe|The Bubbler's]] bubble wand and [[Jagged Stone|Guitar Villain]]'s [[Jagged Stone's guitar|guitar]]. Aside from their peculiar powers, supervillains seem to have enhanced strength, durability, and fighting skills. For example, [[Alya Césaire|Lady Wifi]] manages to pin down Cat Noir when they are both disarmed, and the [[Fred Haprèle|Mime]] is able to hold the [[Eiffel Tower]] with his own strength. [[File:EV S01EP08 (509).png|thumb|Hawk Moth briefly controlling the Evillustrator's hand.|left]] Every villain, after being corrupted, remembers the cause of their distress and the person who caused it, so they usually try to get revenge. Additionally, some villains, namely [[Théo Barbot|Copycat]], the [[Nathaniel Kurtzberg|Evillustrator]], and [[Mylène Haprèle|Horrificator]], remember the people whom they have romantic feelings for (Ladybug, Marinette, and [[Ivan Bruel]] respectively) and still care for them while transformed. Hawk Moth can't mind control his villains, psychologically manipulating them instead.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/872000705967554560 He can't read their minds either, seeing and feeling only what they are seeing and feeling.https://curiouscat.me/MiraculousMX/post/256989254 and https://curiouscat.me/MiraculousMX/post/257013573 However, if a supervillain doesn't go and retrieve the Miraculous like they were asked to, Hawk Moth can control their bodies for a brief amount of time in order to inflict pain onto them until they agree to do it as quickly as possible. He can also remove their powers, another threat he uses against his victims to keep them on-task.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/872020337164251139 [[File:OR1-(1091).png|thumb|Akumas multiplying.]] As seen in "[[Ladybug & Cat Noir (Origins - Part 1)|Ladybug & Cat Noir]]" and "[[Stoneheart (Origins - Part 2)|Stoneheart]]", if Ladybug doesn't purify a villain's akuma when she captures it, the akuma multiplies, and they transform various people into frozen copies of the villain. When the original akuma's victim is akumatized again, the copies unfreeze, and the villain has control over them, able to make them follow his or her orders and desires. Because of Hawk Moth and the villain's mental connection, the villain can sense the location of Hawk Moth's lair if they want to find him, as seen in "Robostus" and "[[The Dark Owl]]". {{HideSpoiler| In "Timetagger", it is shown that akumatized villains can communicate directly to the Butterfly Miraculous holder, even if they are not the one who akumatized them initially, as seen with the titular villain who came from the future and was akumatized by another Hawk Moth that isn't Gabriel.}} == Defeat == [[File:PH S01EP06 (697).png|thumb|Jalil being de-corrupted.|left]] In order to defeat a villain and release the akuma, the akumatized object needs to be destroyed. After the object is destroyed, Ladybug uses her [[yo-yo]] to capture the akuma to "de-evilize" and revert it back into a unakumatized butterfly. After the [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]] has reverted the damage caused since the akuma infected the villain, they are detransformed by the purple substance. Those who are victimized will have their memories either be blurry of what happened (like a dream that can't be remembered)https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/694696400995667968, or can remember what had happened entirely (Like Alya and Nino, who remembered their actions as Oblivio). However, those who volunteered will retain clear memories of their actions, examples being Gabriel Agreste (The Collector) and Lila Rossi (Volpina and Chameleon). == List of akumatized villains == ''To see each villain's akumatized object, see [[List of akumatized objects]]'' === [[Season 1]] === {| class="wikitable" style="width: 100%; " cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" |- ! width="14%" style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Name ! width="15%" style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Episode ! style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Powers ! style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Goal ! style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Villain ! width="10%" style="background-color:#C7222A; border-color: rgb(139, 0, 0); color:white" |Civilian |- |[[Nino Lahiffe|Nino Lahiffe

(a.k.a Silurus)]] |"[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 2|Trash Krakken Part 1]]" |Can control and manipulate both water and catfish. |Wants to keep people from swimming in the Seine. | style="padding:0;" |[[File:Silurus Square.png|115px]] | style="padding:0;" |[[File:Unnamed fisherman Square.png|115px]] |} == Trivia == {{SpoilerButton}} * Many of the supervillains' face masks, such as those of Stormy Weather, Lady Wifi, and the Evillustrator, resemble the shape of a butterfly, most likely in reference to the akumas. Similarly, the four eyeholes in Darkblade's helmet resemble the four wings of a butterfly. [[File:SW (231).png|thumb]] * When an akuma infects the object of the new villain and the light mask appears around their face, the darkened area is almost always an indication of the shape of their mask. * There are some cases in which a villain reappears or gets akumatized in an irregular situation more than once. ** In "[[Timebreaker]]", both Alixes from two different timelines get akumatized. ** Ivan transforms into Stoneheart in both of the [[The Origins Story|Origins]] episodes. ** In "[[The Puppeteer]]", the Puppeteer uses her powers to bring back Lady Wifi, the Evillustrator, and Rogercop. ** According to Hawk Moth, it is implied that Lila may return as a villain due to her not forgiving Ladybug in "[[Volpina]]". *** This occurs in "[[Catalyst]]", when Lila is encouraged because of her anger towards Ladybug, with the tipping point being Gabriel Agreste calling Volpina a copycat. *** This happens a third time in "[[Chameleon]]", when Lila actively takes the Akuma and infects herself to become the titular villain after Adrien declines her romantic affections until she stops her lies. At the end of the episode, she is still angry at Ladybug, implying further future Akumatizations. * After Hawk Moth gives his victims their new names, they accept them, and discard their former names until they are defeated. * Ladybug and Cat Noir usually try to persuade the supervillains to calm down and stop their rampage when they are able to do so. * Most of the villains are seen near Marinette and/or Adrien shortly before the akuma infects them. * In most cases, the villains usually get what they want when they are transformed or after they are defeated. However, this is not always the case. ** After the events of "Volpina", Lila discards Ladybug's apology, thinking that Adrien will never be interested in her. * It is unknown if non-humans, such as animals or [[kwamis]], can be akumatized, but [[Season 2]] will have some answers, as revealed by [[Thomas Astruc]] at San Diego Comic-Con 2016.https://youtu.be/vtO8bbvmU0g?t=3012 ** In [[Robostus]], it is shown that emotionally-aware robots can be akumatized, when it happens to Markov, [[Max Kanté]]'s robot. ** In "[[Queen Wasp (Queen's Battle - Part 2)|Queen Wasp]]", it's shown even Miraculous holders can be akumatized and their Miraculouses can be also be infected by an akuma. [[File:GV (429).png|thumb|Fang as a dragon, transformed by Jagged Stone's akumatization.]] * Various animals and objects that are not infected by the akuma can be transformed indirectly with the akumatized villains. ** Roger Raincomprix's police car transforms with him, its appearance changing and it becoming able to fly. ** When Jagged Stone turns into Guitar Villain, his crocodile Fang is transformed into a dragon. ** Santa Claus's horses turn into reindeer, and his sleigh changes its appearance as well, gaining the ability to fly. ** [[Albert]] is also akumatized alongside Mr. Damocles, as his monitor was the akumatized object; Albert gains a human face, as opposed to his normal cartoon appearance. ** Anarka Couffaine's boat transforms into an indestructible sentient ship that obeys Captain Hardrock's commands and can fire cannonball-shaped speakers and chain anyone. ** Marinette's Grandma (Gina Dupain)'s motorbike changed its appearance and gained the ability to fly when she was akumatized into "[[Befana]]". ** [[Tomoe Tsurugi]]'s car is fused with her own body so she can become Ikari Gozen and trap her victims. * According to [[Nooroo]], the Butterfly Miraculous is meant to create superheroes rather than supervillains. ** While Hawk Moth can force his victims to focus on getting Ladybug and Cat Noir's Miraculouses by threatening to remove their powers or causing them pain, the ability is supposed to be used to keep akumatized heroes from becoming evil.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/872021350373896196 ** Several times, however, akumatized villains would identify themselves as heroes, such as Dark Owl. Some villains call themselves heroes as a ruse, such as Volpina. ** A recurring element is people being akumatized into supervillain versions of heroes, such as Copycat, Antibug, Volpina, Queen Wasp, Rena Rage, and Shell Shock. * [[Thomas Astruc]] noted that Marinette would be a hard person to akumatize as she is an optimistic person.Report on Thomas Astruc at Japan Weekend: https://twitter.com/Ladybug_Cartoon/status/780024002706305024 ** He also noted that Adrien has not yet been akumatized because he is so used to disappointment.Report on Thomas Astruc at Japan Weekend: https://twitter.com/Ladybug_Cartoon/status/780024002706305024 * In "[[Riposte]]", "[[Gigantitan]]", "[[Zombizou]]" and "[[Heroes' Day]]", the akuma is seen by Marinette and/or Adrien before the victim is akumatized. * Marinette was super close to getting akumatized in "[[Chameleon]]" and "[[Zombizou]]" but her emotions became positive and the akuma flew away. * Many previous akumatized villains are re-akumatized during the "Heroes' Day" special in Season 2.[http://miraculousdaily.tumblr.com/post/160777192491/spoilers Tumblr blog miraculousdaily covering the information revealed by the writers on May 17, 2017.] * As shown in "[[Sapotis]]" and "[[Oblivio]]", two people can be akumatized from a single akuma and/or [[List of akumatized objects|object]]. * Most of the akumatized villains' powers are based on their hobbies or interests. For example, [[Nathaniel]]'s hobby is drawing whilst Evillustrator's power is making his drawings to life. * During the Heroes’ Day special, the akumas instantly transform civilians without Hawk Moth directly talking to them like the normal purple akumas do. {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Akumatisierte Schurken]] [[es:Villanos akumatizados]] [[fr:Akumatisés]] [[pl:Super - złoczyńcy]] [[pt-br:Vilões Akumatizados]] [[ru:Жертвы акумы]] [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Villains]] [[Category:Lists]]

{{Icons|Unknown Miraculous}} {{Infobox character |image = French Comic Egyptian Miraculous Holder.png|affiliations = [[Miraculous holders]] |residence = Ancient Egypt |friends = [[Kwamis|Uncertain kwami]] |wieldedmiraculous = unknown |species = Human |only = [[Miraculous: Les Aventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir (comic)|''Miraculous: Les Adventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir'' Issue 1]]|gender = Male}} The '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a past [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]] in ancient Egypt. It isn't certain if they had the [[Cat Miraculous]] or a different [[Miraculouses|Miraculous]].<ref>https://www.comixology.com/Miraculous-Les-Aventures-de-Ladybug-et-Chat-Noir-Vol-1-Les-Origines-1-2/digital-comic/564645</ref>
== Appearance == The Miraculous holder's body was dark gray with feline features, including a tail, cat ears, and yellow sclerae. They wore yellow armlets, a belt, and anklets, and below their belt, they wore a white loincloth.
== Abilities == When transformed, the Miraculous holder had enhanced physical abilities, a [[Miraculous tools|tool]], and a special superpower.<ref>https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/660373733396373504</ref>
== Trivia == * The depiction of the holder appears in the first issue of the comic book series ''[[Miraculous: Les Aventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir (comic)|Miraculous: Les Aventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir]]'', which is a retelling of "[[Ladybug & Cat Noir (Origins - Part 1)]]". ** The comic depicts the holder instead of [[Herakles]], who is pictured on Greek pottery in the original episode. * By looking at this holder's clothing it's most likely that the person is male since men wore short wrap-round skirt. ** As of that he could be from the Old or Middle Kingdom of Egypt.
== Gallery == === Miraculous: Les Aventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir (comic) === <gallery hideaddbutton="true"> Origin 1 - French Comic -1.jpg </gallery>

His attire included a type of red garment for the upper body and two brown bracelets on his left wrist.

His superhero suit is blue with a yellow collar and sleeves, long sleeves, and an image of a light blue door with a yellow doorknob on his chest. Additionally, he has a dark blue cape. == Abilities == Doorman can make portals connecting two distances, like from [[Paris]] to [[New York City|New York]]. == Sightings == === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS2 = yes|IS3 = yes|IS4=yes}} == Trivia == * Doorman's outfit is reminiscent of [[Wikipedia:Superman|Superman]] and other superheroes with similar designs from the [[Wikipedia:Golden Age of Comic Books|Golden Age of Comic Books]]. ** Additionally, another character named [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doorman_(comics) Doorman], who also has the power to create and open portals, exists in Marvel Comics. == Errors == * In the third issue of ''Miraculous Adventures'', Doorman is with the group of superheroes that Ladybug and Cat Noir have to temporarily leave to detransform, but when the duo return, he isn't with the group anymore, despite the rest of the superheroes still being there. == Gallery == === [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3]] === Issue 3 Preview 1.jpg Issue 3 Preview 2.jpg {{Characters}} [[es:Doorman]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Comic characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

[[Camilla Hombee|Camilla Hombee/Victory]] |relatives = {{HideSpoiler|Ignoblia (sister)}} |enemies = [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]] |abilities = Flight |image = Majestia - American Superhero.png }} {{SpoilerButton}} {{Quote|Majestia?! I don't believe it... Majestia! The most powerful, most brave, and most incredible superhero ever!|[[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]]|[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 2|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 2]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a superhero in the United States of America. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Tallish in height, Majestia has short blonde hair and blue eyes. === As Majestia === She wears a red sleeveless vest with a swan-necked collar, three gold stars and two jagged gold lines on the front, and a zipper-like line down the center of the front, along with a long coattail. Underneath the vest, she has a blue suit with exposed shoulders and long sleeves, and she wears red knee-high boots with two jagged gold lines around the upper edge. == Personality == Majestia is brave, friendly, and reliable. She kindly explains information to [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]], such as the need to defeat the [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]]. While she can get impatient and annoyed on occasion, Majestia has a positive, understanding and determined outlook in general about a situation. This allows her to get along well with the superheroes she knows. == Abilities == Majestia can fly even at extremely great heights. == Family == {{Majestia Tree}} == Relationships == === [[Camilla Hombee|Camilla Hombee/Victory]] === Majestia follows Victory's commands loyally, trusting in her judgement to cause a lot of damage in order to stop the Trash Krakken despite temporarily stopping it after getting a less risky plan. When Victory reveals herself in her superhero costume, Majestia congenially notes that Victory doesn't need to wear the mask as everyone knows her secret identity. === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] === Majestia supports and assists Ladybug and Cat Noir, informing them about the Trash Krakken situation and other superheroes. Their sudden departure to de-transform confuses her and she becomes irked when they come back later than promised, but she doesn't hold it against them for long. Particularly, Majestia strongly believes that Ladybug is important to the success of stopping the Trash Krakken, noting that they're all counting on her. She trusts her and Cat Noir with their own plan, to the point of stalling and halting [[Knightowl]]'s plan at Cat Noir's request. Also, Majestia considers Ladybug and Cat Noir's feelings toward each other as "young love", much to the annoyance of Ladybug. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS1|OR=m}} {{AppearancesS2|TDO=p}} {{AppearancesS3|SW2=p|AM=imp|TT=m|PC=toy}} === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS2=yes|IS3=yes|IS4=yes}} == Trivia == * [[Thomas Astruc]] described Majestia as a "fusion between [[Wikipedia:Superman|Superman]] and [[Wikipedia:Wonder Woman|Wonder Woman]]."https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/879120725000499200 ** Additionally, her appearance is similar to that of [[wikipedia:Power Girl|Power Girl]], [[wikipedia:Supergirl (Kara Zor-El)|Supergirl]] and the [[Wikipedia:Carol Danvers|Carol Danvers]] incarnation of [[Wikipedia:Ms. Marvel|Ms. Marvel]]. * [[Alya Césaire]] is a fan of Majestia, reading comic books about her and referencing a quote from her in order to encourage Marinette in "[[Ladybug & Cat Noir]]". ** Majestia's first appearance in the television series is on the cover of a [[Majestia Issue 56|comic book]] about her that Alya has on her [[Alya's cellphone|cellphone]]. ** Alya also has a poster of her in her [[Alya's room|room]]. ** As seen in "Sapotis", Alya has a pajama top with a design based on Majestia's costume. == Gallery == === [[Ladybug & Cat Noir (Origins - Part 1)]] === CTEd1-UWEAA75xz.jpg_large.jpg|Comic book cover depicting Majestia. === [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3]] === Issue 3 Preview 1.jpg Issue 3 Preview 2.jpg === Concept art === Césaire Apartment rooms concept art.jpg {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[fr:Majestia]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]] [[Category:Comic characters]]

[[Camilla Hombee|Camilla Hombee/Victory]] |image = Knightowl - Superhero.png|Knightowl Knight Owl - Civilian Identity.png|Civilian form |only = [[The Dark Owl]] |enemies = [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]] |weapons = Boomerangs}} {{Quote|Cat Noir! Follow us. Time is running out.|Knightowl|[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 2|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 2]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a superhero in the United States with her partner [[Sparrow]]. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Outside of her superhero disguise, Knightowl is a tall woman with a large build. She has light brown eyes, long flowing brown hair, and small red lips. === As Knightowl === Knightowl wears a dark brown cowl with golden spikes akin to an owl's eyebrows over her eyes and a long cape. Underneath, she wears a bodysuit that covers her entire body, including her mouth and chin that aren't covered by the cowl. The suit's shoulders, upper chest, and legs are a darker shade of brown, and on the upper chest, there is a logo of an owl's face comprised of gold lines. Also, she wears brown gloves with gold talon-like claws on the fingers, and she wears a golden belt around her hips. With her mask on, she has dark green irises in her eyes. {{For2|more of Knightowl's outfits and designs|Knightowl/Designs}} == Personality == Knightowl is serious, irritable, and straightforward. Saving others in danger is important to her, which makes her frustrated and stern towards anyone who doesn't take the task as seriously, jokes around, or disobeys orders. Preferring solid, perfect plans without a chance of failing, Knightowl doesn't like questionable or risky suggestions, having little faith in them if they're not based on strong evidence or reasoning. Sometimes, she is willing to put her stubbornness aside to try alternate options and work together with people she doesn't agree with. Liking to take the lead and being good at commanding a team, while she can get impatient with others, Knightowl takes them seriously and gives them clear, strong orders to follow. Tending toward a negative disposition, she judges others harshly, and bluntly gives her opinions of them without consideration. However, Knightowl is experienced, thus knowing the dangers of her job, and calming new fellow superheroes in difficult situations. She also has a softer side, laughing with [[Majestia]] and Sparrow about [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]]'s budding romance. == Abilities == Knightowl is physically fit, having enough stamina and skill to keep up with Ladybug and Cat Noir while they're running, and to jump from edge to edge down a huge crack in the ground. She throws boomerangs based off of her logo with great strength and precision. Additionally, Knightowl is a skilled strategist, devising the initial destructive plan to destroy the Trash Krakken and giving commands to Ladybug, Cat Noir, and Sparrow when they're about to battle him. == Relationships == === [[Sparrow]] === Knightowl treats Sparrow as a sidekick, seeing him in a similar but less judgemental fashion to Cat Noir. She trusts him enough to listen to him and his advice, such as begrudgingly agreeing to stray from her original plan for ten minutes when he persuades her to try Ladybug and Cat Noir's plan. Though close to him, Knightowl continues the mission after his apparent demise, thinking of it as a way of honoring his sacrifice. === Unnamed partner === Knightowl trusts her butler/partner to such a degree that [[Mr. Damocles|a fan]] of hers decided to create an artificial version of said partner, and was attached to it enough for it to become his [[List of akumatized objects|akumatized object]]. === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] === Knightowl is aloof and critical of Ladybug and Cat Noir, displeased with them when they run off briefly so they can detransform, and when they jump down a hole to confront the [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]] instead of following Victory's direction. In particular, she finds Cat Noir annoying, thinking of him as a sidekick who mainly goofs off. However, she knows how important Ladybug is in the mission and relies on Cat Noir to calm her down after the apparent demise of Sparrow. Despite her criticism of them, after they explain how they want to try taking [[Mr. Squid]] from Trash Krakken, Knightowl relents and works with them to execute the plan, though not without disagreements along the way. == Sightings == ===Episodes=== {{AppearancesS2|TDO=p}} {{AppearancesS3|PC=toy}} === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS2=yes|IS3=yes|IS4=yes}} == Trivia == * Knightowl's design is similar to the design of famous comic book superhero [[Wikipedia:Batman|Batman]]. ** Knightowl's name and design are also similar to [[Wikipedia:Nite Owl|Nite Owl]] (specifically, the Daniel Dreiberg incarnation), a superhero from the ''[[Wikipedia:Watchmen|Watchmen]]'' comics who is partially based on Batman. * In the fourth issue of ''Miraculous Adventures'', it is revealed that Knightowl keeps her identity and true gender a secret from the other heroes. * As seen in "The Dark Owl", [[Mr. Damocles]] is a fan of Knightowl, having a suit similar to hers and a small collection of her comics hidden inside his office. == Gallery == === [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3]] === Issue 3 Preview 1.jpg Issue 3 Preview 2.jpg === [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 4]] === Issue 4 Preview 1.jpg Issue 4 Preview 2.jpg Issue 4 Preview 3.jpg Issue 4 Preview 4.jpg Issue 4 Preview 5.jpg Issue 4 Preview 6.jpg {{Characters}} [[es:Knightowl]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

[[Camilla Hombee|Camilla Hombee/Victory]] |enemies = [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]] |abilities = Flight |first = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 2|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 2]] |latest = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 4|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 4]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a superhero in the United States of America. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Uncanny Valley is at a medium height with pale skin. She has dark purple hair and green eyes. === As Uncanny Valley === She wears a skin-tight purple top with light purple sections around her wrists and two light blue rhomboids on her shoulders. She also wears skin-tight purple pants and dark purple lipstick. == Abilities == Uncanny Valley has the ability to fly, which sometimes involve shooting green blasts from her hands. Also, a screen can come out of her lower left arm for viewing images. == Sightings == === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS2=yes|IS3 = yes|IS4=yes}} == Trivia == * Unlike the other superheroes in [[New York City|New York]] who appear in the second issue or ''Miraculous Adventures'', Uncanny Valley is not formally introduced to or revealed by [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]], [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]], or the other heroes. ** She doesn't talk in the third issue, but [[Camilla Hombee|Victory]] reveals her name when giving orders to her and [[Majestia]]. ** Her name is a reference to the ”uncanny valley,” where something inhuman is frighteningly human-looking. == Gallery == === [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3]] === Issue 3 Preview 1.jpg Issue 3 Preview 2.jpg {{Characters}} [[es:Uncanny Valley]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Comic characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

Hawk Moth is trying to track us down!|Barkk|to [[Kwamis]] in "[[Sandboy]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [[Kwamis|kwami]] who is connected to the [[Dog Miraculous]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) With his power, its [[Miraculous holders|wearer]] can use the Miraculous to transform into a dog-themed superhero. He is currently dormant in his Miraculous in [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]]'s [[Miracle Box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". == Appearance == Barkk is light brown with a white mark around his mouth, between his eyes, and on his chest. He has gray eyes, drop ears, a whisker on his forehead, and a pink tongue. He also has a tail that curves upwards. == Abilities == Barkk can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. He can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than himself. As a kwami, Barkk is able to transform the holder of the Dog Miraculous into a dog-themed superhero, although it is currently unknown what the transformation looks like or what powers the transformed person gains. == History == === Before Season 2 === Barkk came into existence when the concept connected to it came into existence. Before the Miraculous jewels were created, he and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Then, thousands of years later, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the [[Miraculouses]]. When its Miraculous was not being worn, Barkk was dormant in the Dog Miraculous, which was stored inside the Miracle Box. === Season 2 === During Season 2, Barkk was dormant in the Dog Miraculous. In "Sandboy", Barkk was celebrating [[Nooroo]]'s birthday in the Miracle Box with the other kwamis, and he was excited when [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]] arrived. He marveled at the gift Tikki brought, a marker that he thought was a paintbrush, and he played with the other kwamis. When it came the time to find Nooroo, Barrk got into position in an effort to contact him, but they contacted his [[Gabriel Agreste|wielder]] instead. Hearing him, the kwamis shuddered at the thought of being his slave, and they prevented him from discovering their location by cutting off the connection. They realized if they contacted Nooroo's wielder, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been akumatized, and Tikki and Plagg's wielders would be in danger. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Barkk was dormant in the Dog Miraculous. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} == Trivia == * Barkk was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. ** Barkk's name was confirmed in the credits of the Latin American Spanish dub of "Sandboy".https://twitter.com/Kyoi_Tekina/status/1061763079581634562 and https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/1061767042565455872 * Dogs are symbols of loyalty, assistance, protection, communication, and other things. * The dog is the eleventh animal of the [[Wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * Barkk has a noticeable feminine voice and uses female pronouns in the English dub, whereas the kwami has a distinctly masculine voice and uses male pronouns in the French dub. == Gallery == === [[Sandboy]] === SB (169).png SB (179).png SB (180).png SB (181).png SB (182).png SB (202).png SB (203).png SB (204).png SB (205).png SB (206).png SB (207).png SB (209).png SB (210).png SB (212).png SB (219).png SB (225).png SB (226).png SB (227).png SB (228).png SB (230).png SB (231).png SB (327).png SB (332).png SB (361).png SB (377).png SB (389).png SB (397).png SB (472).png SB (473).png SB (478).png SB (479).png SB (480).png SB (481).png SB (482).png SB (510).png SB (511).png === Concept art === New_Kwamis_-_Season_2.png {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Barkk]] [[es:Barkk]] [[fr:Barkk]] [[pl:Barkk]] [[pt-br:Barkk]] [[ru:Баркк]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]] [[Category:Minor Characters]]

{{Icons|Kwami|Horse Kwami}} {{Infobox kwami character |image = [[File:Kaalki Square.png|thumb]] |only = [[Sandboy]] |gender = Genderless |pronoun = She/Her |species = [[Kwamis|Kwami]] |miraculous = horse |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = Fanny Bloc (French) |2 = Wirley Contaifer (Brazilian Portuguese)}} |residence = [[Miracle Box]] (dormant) |friends = [[Max Kanté]] |abilities = [[Horse Miraculous Superpower|Telportation]]
Flight
Levitation
Intangibility
Miraculous transformation
Inability to be filmed}} {{Quote|Ladybug and Cat Noir are unable to transform. Go and find your owners right away!|Kaalki to [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]]|"[[Sandboy]]"}} {{SpoilerButton}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is the [[Kwamis|kwami]] who is connected to the [[Horse Miraculous]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) With her power, her [[Miraculous holders|wearer]] can use the Miraculous to transform into a horse-themed superhero. She is currently dormant in her miraculous in [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]]'s [[Miracle Box|jewelry box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". == Appearance == Kaalki is 10 centimeters (or 4 inches) tall and is gray with a white tuft on her head, muzzle, arms, legs, and underbelly. She also has light green eyes, eyelashes, pointed horse ears with white insides, and a thick white tail that curves outwards. == Abilities == Kaalki can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. She can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than herself. {{HideSpoiler|As a kwami, Kaalki is able to transform the holder of the Horse Miraculous into a horse-themed superhero, with the power of teleportation.}} == Relationships == === [[Ziggy]] === Kaalki and Ziggy are seen dancing together at the party that celebrates Nooroo's birthday in "[[Sandboy]]", when they and the other Kwamis begin to find him but had ended up contacting to the Butterfly Miraculous' wielder. After they broke their connection with Hawk Moth; Ziggy is seen attending to Kaalki, which shows that the Horse and Goat Kwamis are possibly close friends, or simply get along with each other. == History == === Before Season 2 === When the concept of space came into existence, Kaalki came into existence. Before the Miraculous jewels were created, Kaalki and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Then, thousands of years ago, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the Miraculouses. When her Miraculous was not being worn, Kaalki was dormant in the Horse Miraculous, which was stored inside the Miracle Box. === Season 2 === During Season 2, Kaalki was dormant in the Horse Miraculous. In "[[Sandboy]]", Kaalki was celebrating [[Nooroo]]'s birthday in the Miracle Box with the others kwamis, and she was excited when [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]] arrived. She marveled at the gift Tikki brought, a marker, and she played with the other kwamis. When it came the time to find Nooroo, Kaalki got into position in an effort to contact him, but the kwamis contacted his [[Gabriel Agreste|wielder]] instead. Hearing his voice, she shuddered at the thought of being his slave, but they prevented him from discovering them by cutting off the connection. But then she realized if they contacted Nooroo's wielder, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been [[Akumatization|akumatized]], and realized that Tikki and Plagg's wielders were in danger. Kaalki instructed Tikki, Plagg, and [[Wayzz]] to find their owners. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Kaalki was dormant in the Horse Miraculous. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} == Trivia == * Kaalki was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. ** Her name was confirmed in the credits of the Latin American Spanish dub of "Sandboy".https://twitter.com/Kyoi_Tekina/status/1061763079581634562 and https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/1061767042565455872 * Some of the things that a horse is a symbol for are grace, beauty, nobility, and freedom. * The horse is the seventh animal of the [[wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * In the English dub, she has a British accent. * Her name is a reference to [[wikipedia:Kalki|Kalki]], the tenth Avatar of Vishnu who is depicted with a white horse. {{Gallery|pagename = Kaalki|image = SB (501).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Kaalki]] [[es:Kaalki]] [[fr:Kaalki]] [[pl:Kaalki]] [[pt-br:Kaalki]] [[ru:Каалки]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]]

They are currently dormant in their Miraculous in [[Wang Fu]]'s [[Miracle Box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". == Appearance == Mullo is 10 centimeters (or 4 inches) tall and is light gray with a small body, two whiskers and a thin tail. They have pink eyes and gray ears with the insides being pink. == Abilities == Mullo can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. They can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than them. As a kwami, Mullo is able to transform the holder of the Mouse Miraculous into a mouse-themed superhero, although it is unknown what the transformation looks like or what powers the transformed person gains. {{SpoilerButton}} {{HideSpoiler|It seems that Mullo and Trixx can fuse their powers to create the hybrid wielder [[Multimouse with Fox Miraculous]].}} == History == === Before Season 2 === Before the Miraculous jewels were created, Mullo and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Thousands of years ago, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the Miraculouses. When their Miraculous was not being worn, Mullo was dormant in the Mouse Miraculous, which was stored inside the Miracle Box. === Season 2 === During Season 2, Mullo was dormant in the Mouse Miraculous. In "Sandboy", Mullo was celebrating [[Nooroo]]'s birthday in the Miracle Box with the other kwamis, and they were excited when [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]] arrived. The kwami marveled at the gift Tikki brought, a marker, and played with the other kwamis. When it came the time to find Nooroo, Mullo got into position in an effort to contact him, but the kwamis contacted his [[Gabriel Agreste|wielder]] instead. Hearing his voice, the kwamis shuddered at the thought of being his slave and prevented them from being discovered when they all cut off the connection. They realized if they contacted Nooroo's wielder, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been [[Akumatization|akumatized]], and Tikki and Plagg's wielders would be in danger. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Mullo was dormant in the Mouse Miraculous. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} == Trivia == * Mullo was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. ** [[Thomas Astruc]] revealed their name on Twitter on November 11, 2018.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/1062115576947097606 * Mice are symbols for many things, including success, ambition, kindness, and resourcefulness. * The mouse🐭(鼠) is the first animal of the [[Wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * Mullo's name is a reference to ''mulot'', a French word for "field mouse." == Gallery == ===[[Sandboy]]=== SB (169).png SB (179).png SB (180).png SB (181).png SB (182).png SB (203).png SB (204).png SB (212).png SB (218).png SB (220).png SB (224).png SB (327).png SB (332).png SB (335).png SB (341).png SB (343).png SB (361).png SB (377).png SB (389).png SB (397).png SB (398).png SB (453).png SB (472).png SB (473).png SB (510).png SB (511).png === Concept art === New_Kwamis_-_Season_2.png {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Mullo]] [[es:Mullo]] [[fr:Mullo]] [[pl:Mullo]] [[pt-br:Mullo]] [[ru:Мулло]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]]

We must try to find out where he's hiding!|Stompp|to [[kwamis]] in "[[Sandboy]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [[Kwamis|kwami]] who is connected to the [[Ox Miraculous]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) With her power, its [[Miraculous holders|wearer]] can use the Miraculous to transform into an ox-themed superhero. She is currently dormant in her Miraculous in [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]]'s [[Miracle Box|jewelry box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". == Appearance == Stompp is grayish blue with narrow black eyes. She also has nostrils, lighter grayish blue ox horns on her head, and a long and skinny tail with a thicker tip. == Personality == Not much is known about Stompp's personality except that she is persistent. == Abilities == Stompp can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. She can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than herself. As a kwami, Stompp is able to transform the holder of the Ox Miraculous into an ox-themed superhero, although it is unknown what the transformation looks like or what powers the transformed person gains. == History == === Before Season 2 === Before the Miraculous jewels were created, Stompp and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Then, thousands of years ago, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the Miraculouses. When the Miraculous was not being worn, Stompp was dormant in the Ox Miraculous, which was stored inside Wang Fu's Miraculous jewelry box. === Season 2 === As of season 2, Stompp has lain dormant in the Ox Miraculous. In "Sandboy", Stompp was celebrating Nooroo's birthday in the Miraculous Box with the other kwamis, and was excited when Tikki and Plagg arrived. She marveled at the gift Tikki brought, thought it was a paintbrush, and played with the other kwamis. When it came the time to find Nooroo, Stompp got into position but in an effort to contact him, they contacted his wielder instead. Seeing this as their chance to find Nooroo, she encouraged the others to keep to singing. Hearing his voice, she shuddered at the thought of being his slave and prevented them from being discovered when they all cut off the connection. But then she realized if they contacted Nooroo's wielder, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been akumatized, and the danger Tikki's and Plagg's wielders were in. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Stompp was dormant in the Ox Miraculous. == Trivia == * Stompp was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. ** Her name was confirmed in the credits of the Latin American Spanish dub of "Sandboy".https://twitter.com/Kyoi_Tekina/status/1061763079581634562 and https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/1061767042565455872 * The ox symbolizes strength, wealth, and sacrifice. * The ox is the second animal of the [[Wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * Stompp has a noticeable feminine voice and uses female pronouns in the English dub whereas the kwami has a distinctly masculine voice and uses male pronouns in the French dub. == Gallery == === [[Sandboy]] === SB (169).png SB (170).png SB (171).png SB (174).png SB (175).png SB (176).png SB (177).png SB (178).png SB (185).png SB (191).png SB (192).png SB (193).png SB (200).png SB (201).png SB (202).png SB (203).png SB (204).png SB (212).png SB (221).png SB (222).png SB (223).png SB (327).png SB (332).png SB (335).png SB (341).png SB (343).png SB (361).png SB (377).png SB (389).png SB (397).png SB (453).png SB (461).png SB (462).png SB (463).png SB (464).png SB (510).png SB (511).png === Concept art === New_Kwamis_-_Season_2.png Ox Kwami Concept Art.png {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Stompp]] [[es:Stompp]] [[fr:Stompp]] [[pl:Stompp]] [[pt-br:Stompp]] [[ru:Стомпп]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]]

{{Icons|Kwami}} {{US Spoiler}} {{Infobox kwami character |image = Longg Square.png |gender = Genderless |species = [[Kwamis|Kwami]] |miraculous = dragon |pronoun = He/Him |only = [[Sandboy]] |residence = [[Miracle Box]] (dormant) |likes = {{HideSpoiler|Doing things in style}} |friends = [[Kwamis|Other kwamis]]
{{HideSpoiler|[[Kagami Tsurugi]]
[[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]]}} |abilities = {{HideSpoiler|[[Dragon Miraculous Superpower|Wind Dragon
Water Dragon
Unnamed Lightning Power]]
}}Flight
Levitation
Intangibility
Miraculous transformation
Inability to be filmed}} {{SpoilerButton}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is the [[Kwamis|kwami]] who is connected to the [[Dragon Miraculous]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) With his power, its [[Miraculous holders|wearer]] can use the Miraculous to transform into a dragon-themed superhero. He is currently dormant in his Miraculous in [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]]'s [[Miracle Box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". {{HideSpoiler|In "[[Ikari Gozen]]", he becomes active to help [[Kagami Tsurugi]] transform into Ryuko.}} == Appearance == Longg is red with four black horns on his forehead: a black horn on each side of his face, and red horns from the upper back of his head with black spirals. Additionally, he has golden eyes, a whisker on each cheek next to his mouth, two small black spikes on his lower back, and a long tail with three black tips at the end. {{HideSpoiler| == Personality == Longg is a bit formal calling Kagami "young lady" having a gentleman's approach and is quite informative explaining his powers. He has a tendency to ramble on a bit not seeing that his wielder is trapped inside an akumatized villain, but knows not to rush as he tried to tell Kagami Ladybug's plans.}} == Abilities == Longg can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. He can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than him. As a kwami, Longg is able to transform the holder of the Dragon Miraculous into a dragon-themed superhero. {{HideSpoiler|He gives the user the power to use abilities of water, air and lightning transforming into one of the three elements they chose just by saying water, air or lightning dragon. After all three elements have been used Longg loses energy giving the wearer five minutes until they transform back. It seems that Longg can fuse his powers with Tikki's to create the hybrid wielder [[Dragon Bug]]. == Relationships == === [[Kagami Tsurugi]] === As Longg and Kagami meet the Dragon Kwami tells her the abilities he'll grant her as Ryuko, but as she activates the Miraculous, Longg tries to stop her before he could fully inform Kagami of Ladybug's plan. === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] === Longg knowing Ladybug's plan to defeat Ikari Gozen, as he had tried to tell it to Kagami before she activates transformation of the Kwami's miraculous, indicates that Ladybug might have gone over it with Longg before sending the Dragon Miraculous Kagami's way. As well as how she knows the Kwami's name, when she asked Ryuko if Longg had indeed gone over their plan with her.}} == History == === Before Season 2 === When the concept of weather came into existence, Longg came into existence. Before the Miraculous jewels were created, Longg and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Then, thousands of years ago, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the [[Miraculouses]]. When his Miraculous was not being worn, Longg was dormant in the Dragon Miraculous, which was stored inside the Miracle Box. === Season 2 === During Season 2, Longg was dormant in the Dragon Miraculous. In "Sandboy", Longg was celebrating [[Nooroo]]'s birthday in the Miracle Box with the other kwamis, and they were excited when [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]] arrived. The kwamis marveled at the gift Tikki brought, a marker, and played with each other. When the time to find Nooroo came, Longg got into position in an effort to contact him, but the kwamis contacted his [[Gabriel Agreste|wielder]] instead. Hearing his voice, the kwamis shuddered at the thought of being his slave and prevented them from being discovered when they all cut off the connection. They realized if they contacted Nooroo's wielder, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been [[Akumatization|akumatized]], and Tikki and Plagg's wielders would be in danger. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Longg was dormant in the Dragon Miraculous. {{HideSpoiler| In "Ikari Gozen", Longg and his Miraculous were loaned to Kagami as a "special delivery" by Ladybug. Upon meeting her he tried to explain his powers and Ladybug's plan to his wielder but became surprised when Kagami said the words, instantly transforming her into Ryuko, without informing her fully. After the trio saved his wielder's mother, Longg and his Miraculous were returned to Ladybug and then to Master Fu.}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|IG=yes}} == Trivia == * Longg was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. ** [[Thomas Astruc]] confirmed its name on Twitter on November 11, 2018.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/1062115576947097606 * Longg is the only currently known kwami to be based on a mythical animal. * Chinese dragons symbolize good luck, prosperity, heroism, boldness, and more. * The dragon is the fifth animal of the [[Wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * Longg's name is based on ''lóng'' (龙/龍), the Chinese word for "dragon." {{Gallery|image = SB (217).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Longg]] [[es:Longg]] [[fr:Longg]] [[pl:Longg]] [[pt-br:Longg]] [[ru:Лонгг]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]]

revision.text:
{{Icons|Kwami|Snake Kwami}} {{Infobox kwami character |image = [[File:Sass_Square.png|thumb]] |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Ben Diskin]] (English)https://twitter.com/BenjaminDiskin/status/1054121895593832448 |2 = Alexandre Nguyen (French) |3 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Miguel Leal|Miguel Leal]] (Latin American Spanish) |4 = Alexandre Maguolo (Brazilian Portuguese)}} |gender = Genderless |pronoun = He/Him |only = [[Sandboy]] |species = [[Kwamis|Kwami]] |miraculous = snake |friends = [[Tikki]]
[[Plagg]]
[[Nooroo]]
[[Duusu]]
[[Kwamis|Other kwamis]]
{{HideSpoiler|[[Luka Couffaine]]
[[Adrien Agreste]]}} |abilities = [[Second Chance]]
Flight
Levitation
Intangibility
Miraculous transformation
Inability to be filmed |residence = [[Miracle Box]] (dormant) }} {{SpoilerButton}} {{Quote|It is a good thing you are here. Your owners were wise to give you permission to come.|Sass|to [[Tikki]] & [[Plagg]] in "[[Sandboy]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is the [[Kwamis|kwami]] who is connected to the [[Snake Miraculous]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) With his power, its [[Miraculous holders|wearer]] can use the Miraculous to transform into a snake-themed superhero. He is currently dormant in his Miraculous in [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]]’s [[Miracle Box]], as seen in "[[Sapotis]]". == Appearance == Sass is 10 centimeters (or 4 inches) tall, he is sea green, and has a broad, triangular head, resembling a cobra. His eyes are yellow with narrow black pupils, his mouth has two pointed fangs, and he has a sea green forked tongue. Additionally, he has a long tail, and from the top of his head and down his back to the tip of his tail, he has a black diamond line pattern. == Personality == Sass is the defacto leader of the kwamis in the Miracle Box, meaning he is mature, charming, calm and serious. {{HideSpoiler|Like Longg, he has a bit of a formal side happily greetings his owners. Due to the unique ability of his powers Sass has high expectations of those he his partnered with.}} == Abilities == Sass can fly, levitate, and phase through solid objects. He can also carry objects that are larger and/or heavier than himself. As a kwami, Sass is able to transform the holder of the Snake Miraculous into a snake-themed superhero,with the power to go back in time with [[Second Chance]]. {{HideSpoiler|It seems that Sass can fuse his powers with Plagg's to create the hybrid wielder [[Snake Noir]].}} == Relationships == === [[Tikki]] and [[Plagg]] === Sass treats Tikki and Plagg as equals and considers them of being high virtue, given that he assumed they both got permission from their owners and from [[Wang Fu|the Great Guardian of the Miraculouses]] to participate in the ceremony inside the [[Miracle Box]]. {{HideSpoiler| === [[Adrien Agreste]] === Sass appears to have a friendly relationship with Adrien, though Adrien likely left a poor impression on Sass after failing to make good use of [[Second Chance]] over 25,900 times. === [[Luka Couffaine]] === Sass appears to get along well with Luka. Sass likely thinks highly of Luka after comparing him to his recent temporary owner, Adrien, who proved to be a failure with the Snake Miraculous. }} == History == === Before Season 2 === When the concept of second chance came into existence, Sass came into existence. Before the Miraculous jewels were created, Sass and the other kwamis traveled all over the universe unable to interact with humans. Then, thousands of years ago, a [[Unnamed mage|mage]] created the Miraculouses. When its Miraculous was not being worn, Sass was dormant in the Snake Miraculous, which was stored inside Wang Fu's Miraculous jewelry box. === Season 2 === As of Season 2, Sass is dormant in the Snake Miraculous. In "Sandboy", Sass was celebrating Nooroo's birthday in the Miraculous Box with the others kwamis, and was excited when Tikki and Plagg arrived. As the other kwamis marveled at the gift Tikki brought, Sass expressed his thanks to Tikki's and Plagg's owners for letting them come. He noticed Tikki trying to say her owner's name but understood what she meant, also that they got the guardian's permission and played with the other kwamis. When it came the time to find Nooroo, Sass commanded the kwamis into position but as they tried to sing they realized they weren't going to make it. He pointed out that they were missing [[Duusu]] seeing this as their only opportunity to find Nooroo Sass told Plagg to get Wayzz but in an effort to contact him, they contacted Hawk Moth instead. Hearing his voice, he shuddered at the thought of being his slave and prevented them from being discovered when they all cut off the connection. But then he realized if they contacted Hawk Moth, rather than Nooroo, then someone must have been akumatized, and the danger [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] and [[Adrien Agreste]] were in. === Season 3 === During Season 3, Sass was dormant in the Snake Miraculous, becoming active in "Party Crasher" to allow Luka to transform into Viperion. {{HideSpoiler|In "Desperada", Sass came out of the Snake Miraculous when it was temporarily given to Adrien by Ladybug. Who then helped him transform into Aspik, after his power was used in saving Ladybug and failing to defeat Desperada many times. They detransform with Sass landing in Adrien's hands exhausted, he returned to the Snake Miraculous then to Ladybug who then gives it to Luka. After Sass introduced himself and told Luka how to transform, he turns him into Viperion and by using the Second Chance power to devise a plan. They able to help Ladybug and Cat Noir in defeating Desperada. After that, Sass was dormant in the Snake Miraculous again and Ladybug returned it to Master Fu.}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|DE=yes}} == Trivia == * Sass was first revealed from a [[Season 2|second season]] trailer on August 31, 2017. * Snakes are symbols of rebirth, patience, intuition, and healing, among other things. * The snake is the sixth animal of the [[Wikipedia:Chinese zodiac|Chinese zodiac]]. * Sass appears to be the leader of the Kwamis inside the Miracle Box.  * Due to his hood and the black diamond pattern on his back, Sass appears to be based on both cobras and eastern or western diamond-backed rattlesnakes. {{Gallery|pagename = Sass|image = SB (249).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Sass]] [[es:Sass]] [[fr:Sass]] [[pl:Sass]] [[pt-br:Sass]] [[ru:Сасс]] [[Category:Kwamis]] [[Category:Genderless]]

{{Icons|Kwami}} {{Infobox kwami character |image = Ziggy Square.png |gender = Genderless |pronoun = She/Her |species = [[Kwamis|Kwami]] |miraculous = goat |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = Céline Melloul (French) |2 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Betzabé Jara|Betzabé Jara]] (Latin American Spanish) }} |only = [[Sandboy]] |residence = [[Miracle Box]] (dormant) |abilities = Flight
Levitation
