{{Youmay|the students in Ms. Mendeleiev's class|[[Ms. Mendeleiev's classroom]]}} {{Infobox character |image = RK (5).png |first = [[Reflekta]] |latest = [[Zombizou]] |age = 13-15 |occupation = Students |affiliations = [[Collège Françoise Dupont]] |residence = [[Paris]], France }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' are the students taught by [[Ms. Mendeleiev]] in her [[Ms. Mendeleiev's classroom|classroom]] at [[Collège Françoise Dupont]].
== List of students == ''In alphabetical order by last name:'' * [[Aurore Beauréal]] * [[Mireille Caquet]] * [[Jean Duparc]] * Eleven unnamed students
== Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS1|RK=yes}} {{AppearancesS2|ZB=yes}}
== Trivia == * The entire class as a whole has only appeared in "Reflekta" and "Zombizou" thus far, although multiple students from the class have appeared in the background of the collège and other locations. ** Most of the students are common background models, with four models being shared among three students each yet with different colors. * Ms. Mendeleiev teaches [[Caline Bustier|Miss Bustier]]'s [[Miss Bustier's class|class]] on some occasions. It is unknown if her class is taught by another teacher, such as Miss Bustier, when she is not teaching them. * So far, only two students in Ms. Mendeleiev's class, Aurore and Jean, have been [[Akumatization|akumatized]] into [[Akumatized villains|supervillains]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]]. * As seen in "Reflekta", some of the students in Ms. Mendeleiev's class were in Miss Bustier's class during the previous school year. {{Characters}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Students]] [[Category:Teenagers]]

{{Icons|Akumatized villain}} {{Infobox character |image = Caline Bustier Square.png|Caline Zombizou Square 1.png|Zombizou |gender = Female |occupation = Teacher |species = Human |first = [[Mr. Pigeon]] |latest = [[Mayura (Heroes' Day - Part 2)|Mayura]] |residence = [[Paris]], France |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Dorothy Fahn]] (English) |2 = Jessie Lambotte (French) |3 = [[:w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Alina Galindo|Alina Galindo]] (Latin American Spanish) |4 = [[:w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Paqui Horcajo|Paqui Horcajo]] (European Spanish) |5 = Sylvia Sallusti (Brazilian Portuguese) |6 = Germana Savo (Italian) |7 = Isabelle Schmidt (German) |8 = Talya Barkai (טליה ברקאי) (Hebrew) |9 = Vesna Paštrović (Serbian) |10 = Aisha Ali (عائشہ علی) (Urdu) }} |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly)
[[Chloé Bourgeois]] (formerly) |supervillain identity = Zombizou |weapons = Her lip balm (as Zombizou)|full name = Caline Bustier|friends = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]]|abilities = Strength & Agility (as Zombizou) Zombifying Kisses (as Zombizou)|aliases = Miss Bustier}} {{Quote|"Come on, there are much worse people in Paris right now than [[Chloé Bourgeois]]! I'm sure people like Chloé are capable of great things. The problem is they only think of themselves. They don't understand the meaning of love. And we can't force them to change. But perhaps we can show them by setting a good example. That's why Marinettes are so important in today's world, because they have a lot of love to give! I'm counting on you!"|Caline|"[[Zombizou]]"|quotelink = yes}} '''Miss {{PAGENAME}}'''Thomas' Twitter, the tweet since deleted. is a teacher at [[Collège Françoise Dupont]].https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/655079661588885504 In "[[Zombizou]]", while trying to protect [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] from an [[Akuma|akuma]], Caline is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Zombizou''', a zombie kissing [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].https://tvschedule.zap2it.com/overview.html?programSeriesId=SH02296324&tmsId=SH022963240000&from=sl&aid=gapzap == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Caline is tall and light-skinned with reddish-orangish hair, which she pulls back in a high bun, teal eyes, thin light pink lips and freckles. === Civilian attire === She wears a light blue jacket with a teal collared shirt and a white undershirt beneath, along with a pair of white earrings and a small gold necklace. She also wears light blue pants and white dress shoes. === As Zombizou === Zombizou is a grey-skinned villain with grey hair and grey-blue eyes. She wears black lipstick in a heart shape. She wears a butterfly-shaped pink mask, curved on top and curving to point beneath the eyes. She wears a primarily black dress with torn sleeves and adorned with a pink heart and a smaller black heart within it. The black heart has a pink lipstick stain on it. The dress has pink puffy sleeves that feature a stapled design, a la Frankenstein. Zombizou wears her hair in a bun decorated with two pink hair sticks with large round ends. She appears to wield a black lipstick. {{For2|more of Caline's outfits and designs|Caline Bustier/Designs}} == Personality == === As a civilian === Caline is a pleasant, kind, helpful and instructive teacher. Even though she is kind to her students, she can be stern with them if they misbehave and she will send them to [[Mr. Damocles]]' [[Mr. Damocles' office|office]] if she thinks it's necessary. When [[André Bourgeois]] is upset at her when [[Chloé Bourgeois]] loses her bracelet in "[[Rogercop]]", she is indignant at the rebellion. However, if a villain or another threat appears, Caline gets nervous, as seen when Rogercop questions her, and will suggest to her students that they leave if it becomes potentially dangerous, as seen in "[[Lady Wifi]]". Caline also has incredible willpower, being able to initially resist becoming infected by an akuma in "Zombizou," something not very many can do. === As Zombizou === Zombizou views on love becomes warped, believing that she is spreading love by turning people into kissing zombies. == Abilities == === As a civilian === Caline is adept in teaching. As a teacher, she teaches French, literature, poetry and other languages. In "[[Zombizou]]" , she is shown to resist or even overcome Hawk Moth's influence ( something not very many akumatized victims can do ), though unfortunately she succumbed after approximately 30 seconds. === As Zombizou === With her lipstick, Zombizou is able to blow kisses that turn people into zombies who seek to kiss and hug other people. The zombies have contagious kisses. Zombizou also has enhanced physical abilities such as strength and agility. == Relationships == === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette Dupain-Cheng/Ladybug]] === [[File:LW_S01EP07_(270).png|thumb|left|Miss Bustier sends Marinette to the principal.]] Caline likes Marinette because she views her as a kind and helpful person, though she can be stern with her when needed, such as when she sent her to Mr. Damocles' office in "Lady Wifi" after she came in late and disrupted the class. In "Zombizou", when she notices how angry Marinette is over Chloé ruining the gift she made, Caline encourages Marinette to set a positive example for her classmates by forgiving Chloé. When she spots an akuma near her, she tries to shoo it away, refusing to let one of her students be akumatized. [[File:MA_(394).png|thumb|Caline is happy to see that Ladybug is still around.]] Like most Parisians, Caline is highly appreciative of Ladybug and all the work she does in order to protect Paris. However, as Zombizou, she doesn’t like that Ladybug is trying to stop her from “spreading love” and even demands that she accept her “love” and surrender her Miraculous. === [[Chloé Bourgeois]] === While Caline is aware of Chloé's unkindness, Caline doesn't dislike her unlike her students. While everyone else is upset with Chloé in "Zombizou" after she ruins Marinette's gift, Caline is more forgiving. She tells Marinette that she believes that Chloé needs a positive example in order to better herself. As Zombizou, she primarly targets Chloé, wanting to turn her into a kissing zombie. After being deakumatized, Chloé apologizes to Caline and Caline accepts the apology and embraces her. === [[Lila Rossi]] === [[File:Catalyst_(148).png|left|thumb|Miss Bustier thanks Lila for her "charity work"]]Like most of her students, Caline is unaware of Lila's deceitful nature as she believes Lila when she says on a video chat that she is in the Kingdom of Achu and working on a project to reduce pollution, calling it incredible. In "Chameleon", she believes Lila's lie about having tinnitus and needing a front row seat. {{History}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS1|MP=yes|CC=back|LW=yes|RC=yes|DC=yes|DB=yes|TG=yes|AB=back|RK=yes|PX=yes|OR=yes|SH=yes}} {{AppearancesS2|ZB=yes|FN=p|DB=back|TM=p|RB=back|GL=p|ML=yes|CA=yes|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|CH=yes|OB=yes|TT=p|GM2=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|LSA=yes|MIP=m|MAF=yes|MDL=yes|ALB=yes|MAL=back}} {{AppearancesTFP|HWE=m}} === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS5=m}} {{AppearancesCB|LA=yes}} === Other === {{AppearancesNon-Canon|BRM=yes}} == Trivia == * Caline looks noticeably similar to the character Lucille from ''[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Monster_in_Paris A Monster in Paris]. ''Despite this, no one who designed Caline ever saw ''A Monster in Paris'' and their similarities are entirely coincidental.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/689514358565634048 * Her akumatized form was first revealed as a silhouette in a promotional poster on [[Jeremy Zag]]'s Instagram.https://www.instagram.com/p/BZg2ST6n097/?hl=en * Caline celebrates her birthday in "Zombizou." * Caline was the first character in the show to be akumatized not because of a person, but by the akuma itself. {{Gallery|image = DB S01EP12 (168).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Caline Bustier]] [[es:Caline Bustier]] [[fr:Caline Bustier]] [[pl:Caline Bustier]] [[pt-br:Caline Bustier]] [[ru:Кэлин Бюстье]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:School employees]]

{{Infobox character |gender = Female |species = Human |occupation = US President
Superhero |residence = United States of America |first = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 3]] |latest = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 4|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 4]] |name = Camilla Hombee
(a.k.a. Victory) |superhero identity = Victory |image = Camilla (disguised).png|Camilla Victory.png|Victory |friends = [[Majestia]]
[[Doorman]]
[[Knightowl]]
[[Sparrow]]
[[Uncanny Valley]]
[[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]]
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] |weapons = Shield |enemies = [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]]}} {{Quote|"You know, Madam President, you can do without the mask. Everyone knows your secret identity."
"I know, but I like it."|[[Majestia]] and Victory|[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 3]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is the president of the United States of America, as well as the civilian identity of '''Victory''', a superhero. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Camilla is at a regular adult height with brown skin, golden brown eyes, and short curly reddish brown hair. === Civilian attire === She wears a tan trench coat and black boots. Over her natural hair, she wears a long, straight dark brown wig. === As Victory === Victory wears a dark blue mask. She wears a red, white, and blue body suit. The upper body and the upper arms are blue with a white star on each section. The hips and lower arms are solid red, and the rest of her body and her legs have red and white horizontal stripes. Additionally, she wears blue gloves, and she has blue boots with white marks on the fronts. She carries a white star-shaped shied. == Personality == Camilla is proud, determined, and stubborn. She is a strong leader as she handles herself professionally in front of other superheroes, but she thinks highly of her ideas and isn't always open to other people's suggestions and insights. When others prove expertise and bravery that gain her appreciation, though, Camilla listens to their advice and trusts them as allies. Due to years of experiences with villains, viewing many of them as merciless, Camilla cares most about stopping them, not bothering to ask questions on their motives or identity until afterwards. She is willing to use whatever method it takes to save the day, even if it's catastrophic, and the safety of humanity matters greatly to her. == Abilities == Being the president, Camilla has skills in politics, communication and leadership. As Victory, she uses a shield to protect herself. == Relationships == === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] === Camilla is aware of Ladybug's [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]], and she puts trust in the ability to revert everything to normal after using a powerful and destructive attack on the [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]]. However, she sees Ladybug in an inferior light, describing her as "the superheroes' cleaning lady" and considering [[akumatized villains]] to be nowhere near as serious or dangerous as other types of villains. Additionally, though she listens to Ladybug's questions and concerns about her plan to defeating the Trash Krakken, she doesn't think them over, strongly feeling like the current plan is the one option they have. However, she believes in Ladybug as an essential role for the superheroes' success to save [[New York City]]. She shows respect towards Ladybug after Ladybug finds another solution that defeats the Trash Krakken, and she assures her that scientists will look into the unknown [[Unnamed black substance|black substance]] that created the monster as she leaves. == Sightings == === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS3=yes|IS4=yes}} == Trivia == * Camilla revealed her secret identity to the public so that she would have a better chance of making it through the election. * Based on her outfit, a costume decorated in the style of the American Flag, and her very prominent use of a shield, it's likely she was based on the Marvel Comics character Captain America. {{Characters}} [[es:Camilla Hombee]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Comic characters]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

{{Infobox character |gender = Female |species = Human |image = Kenya.png |first = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 3]] |latest = [[Miraculous Adventures Issue 4|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 4]] |residence = [[New York City]], USA |relatives = [[Kenya's father|Father]] |likes = [[Mr. Squid]]}} {{Quote|If I'm not here [at the hospital] when Daddy and Mr. Squid come back, they're going to be super sad!|Kenya|[[Miraculous Adventures Issue 3|''Miraculous Adventures'' Issue 3]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a girl who lives in [[New York City]] with her [[Kenya's father|father]].
== Appearance == === Physical appearance === Kenya is short with brown skin, light brown eyes, and a gap between two upper teeth. She has shoulder-length curly dark brown hair with straight bangs.
=== Civilian attire === She wears a purple t-shirt with a white daisy on the front and short blue skirt underneath. Also, she wears a blue skirt and light pink dress shoes.
''For more of Kenya's outfits and designs, see [[Kenya/Designs]].''
== Personality == Kenya is kind and passionate. She is upbeat, but she cries when upset and not allowed to do something, like stay at the hospital during its evacuation. Loving her father deeply, she worries about him when he hasn't returned from retrieving her stuffed animal [[Mr. Squid]], and she doesn't want to leave the hospital under he returns. However, she takes kindness and assurance from others well, perking up when [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]] promises that she can return to the hospital soon once the [[Kenya's father|Trash Krakken]] is defeated.
== Family == {{Kenya Tree}}
== Sightings == === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS3=yes|IS4=yes}}

[[Mr. Damocles]] (status unknown) |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Grant George]] (English) |2 = Alexandre Nguyen (French) |3 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Francisco Vargas|Francisco Vargas]] (Latin American Spanish) |4 = Patrik Cieslik (German) |5 = Davide Perino (Italian) }} |gender = Genderless |pronoun = He/Him |friends = [[Max Kanté]]

Getting wet}} {{Quote|With all due respect, Mrs. Mendeleiev, I'm not a toy. My name is Markov, and I'm Max's best friend!|Markov|"[[Robostus]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a robot created by [[Max Kanté]]. In "[[Robostus]]", after Markov gets confiscated by [[Mr. Damocles]], he is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Robostus''', a [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]] who brings machines to life. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Markov is a small robot that is mostly blue and gray. On top of his head, he has a propeller with a blue blade and a black shaft with white stripes. Moreover, Markov has a transparent blue tactile sensor, a gray face with a button that has a blue heart engraved on it, a turquoise screen that has two black dots which resemble his eyes, and two blue ear-like round sections on his sides that have a white outline and a musical symbol on the center of each ear. Below his head, Markov has a white USB port, and attached to his body is a blue and gray mechanical arm which has a gray claw and black palm. Inside his body, Markov has a white rectangular CPU with many LED lights and a small face engraved in the center with words reading "Markov 1.4." === As Robostus === Robostus' main body interface stays the same, except his colors have changed: his propeller, screen, ears, mechanical arm, and claw are bright red; the musical symbols and the outline engraved on his ears are black; and its tactile sensor and eyes are neon green. Inside Robostus' body, the same CPU is dark gray with red LED lights and a green face. == Personality == Although Markov is a robot and his capability and intelligence of emotions are limited, Markov is still very conscious and self-aware. Markov is quite naive, but he is also friendly, polite, and joyful, getting along with everyone very well. He also seems to have a whimsical nature as he has the ability to be humorous. However, he is a bit sensitive and easily gets downhearted if he is insulted in any way. Additionally, Markov is inquisitive as, even when akumatized, he asks multiple questions to [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] as to why he needs to capture [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]]'s [[Miraculouses]], and he asks Max to define akumatization. As Robostus, he is very sinister, malicious, and demanding. He is very eager to capture Ladybug and Cat Noir's Miraculouses as Hawk Moth requested. Not withstanding, Robostus eventually chooses to disobey Hawk Moth's commands, consequently attacking him and taunting him, because he realizes that the Miraculouses can grant his wish to make him human. Robostus still cares deeply for Max during his akumatization, but when Max betrays him, he decides that humanity is heartless and humans need to be destroyed. Robostus takes pride in his robotic intelligence and strategics, but he fails to consider his own potential for missteps and the cleverness of his enemies. == Abilities == === As a robot === Markov flies with his propeller and he uses his claw to grab objects. He can verbally communicate with others, but there is a button on one side of him that turns his volume on and off. Also, on the back of his head is the power button so people can turn him on and off altogether. Like Max, Markov is a genius who helped to create an anti flash drive and calculated the distance to capture Ladybug's [[Lucky Charm]]. Along with other beings with artificial intelligence in worldwide network, he is looking for a solution to the global warming crisis. === As Robostus === Robostus gains the ability of technopathy, which allows him to animate mechanical objects and wreak havoc. Given limited but useful intelligence, the objects can move and attack speedily in any way that best suits them, physically moving or hovering, and some objects can even communicate, a lamp flashing it's light on and off to speak Morse code, for example. However, if the objects are broken into pieces or damaged, they become lifeless again. Robostus can also make large mechanical objects form a huge robot that he can control and drive from the inside. == Relationships == === [[Max Kanté]] === [[File:MaxAndMarkov.jpg|thumb|left|Markov accompanied by Max.]]Markov has a high appreciation and fondness for his creator and friend. He helps Max create an anti-virus flash drive, and he gives advice to him on occasion. However, he is upset when people disregard their friendship, and because he is never away from Max, he gets worried when Mr. Damocles takes him to his office without Max. Once he is de-evilized and re-activated, Markov is happy to see Max again. As Robostus, he keeps his compassion towards Max, making sure he isn't hurt and that they aren't separated again. He decides to use the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and [[Cat Miraculous]] to become human; but when Max prevents him and tells him they won't be friends if he hurts Ladybug and Cat Noir, he gets upset and angrily rejects Max as a heartless human. === [[Ms. Mendeleiev]] === [[File:MarkovMad.jpg|thumb|Markov is offended when Ms. Mendeleiev calls him a toy.]]When Ms. Mendeleiev expresses her disbelief that robots can have true emotion and views Markov as a toy, Markov argues with her that his emotions are his own and not programmed into him, believing she is being unreasonable. When akumatized, he doesn't allow her to separate him from Max. === [[Mr. Damocles]] === Markov is impressed by Mr. Damocles' IT skills, but he fears Mr. Damocles putting him inside of his desk in his office. When akumatized, he tells Mr. Damocles that he misjudged him and his capabilities. === [[Miss Bustier's class|Max's classmates]] === Markov, having learned about the students from Max, happily greets them when they first meet in Ms. Mendeleiev's classroom. He declares that he is even glad to get to meet [[Chloé Bourgeois]].  == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|RB=yes|SY=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|GM2=yes|PC=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|MX=yes}} == Trivia == * Markov was first revealed in a Brazilian synopsis for Season 2 on O Universo da TV.http://www.ouniversodatv.com/2017/10/gloob-estreia-novos-episodios-de.html#axzz4ukj8DxGx ** His akumatized form was first revealed as a silhouette in a promotional poster on [[Jeremy Zag]]'s Instagram.https://www.instagram.com/p/BZg2ST6n097/?hl=en * Robostus is the first non-human character to be akumatized. * The first for an akumatized villain, Robostus entirely disobeys Hawk Moth and turns against him, the latter unable to use force to rein him in or remove his powers. ** He also asks what the Miraculouses are and learns about the wish-granting power of combining the Ladybug Miraculous and Cat Miraculous. ** He is the very first villain to want the heroes' Miraculouses for himself besides Hawk Moth. * Markov is the first akumatized villain to have an aesthetic change in his appearance as opposed to a cosmetic one ([[Alya Césaire|Lady Wifi]], [[Chloé Bourgeois|Antibug]], [[Xavier Ramier|Mr. Pigeon]], etc.) or a drastic one ([[Mylène Haprèle|Horrificator]], [[Théo Barbot|Copycat]], [[Otis Césaire|Animan]], etc). *In "Syren", Markov says that his circuits are sensitive to water meaning he's not waterproof. * Markov's appearance is similar to a LEGO® Robot model using structures and ball joints similar to it. {{Gallery|image = Robostus Promotional Artwork.jpg}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Markov]] [[es:Markov]] [[fr:Markov]] [[pl:Markov]] [[pt-br:Markov]] [[ru:Марков]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Genderless]] [[Category:Technology]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

{{Infobox team |image = Order Of The Guardians - Temp Screenshot 1.png |caption = Children being trained at the temple to become guardians. |members = [[Wang Fu]] |status = Destroyed |only episode = [[The Collector]] |affiliations = [[Miraculouses]]
[[Miraculous holders]] |aliases = Guardians of the Miraculous}} {{Quote|We guardians are responsible for protecting and distributing the Miraculous for the good of all humanity.|[[Wang Fu]]|"[[The Collector]]"}} The '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a group of guardians who protect and deliver [[Miraculouses]]. [[Wang Fu|Master Wang Fu]] is the last known remaining guardian.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpyV_2Du9SI&t=53s == History == [[File:Order Of The Guardians - Temp Screenshot 2.png|left|thumb|Wang Fu leaving the destroyed temple.]] The Order of the Guardians existed for many years, inhabiting a [[Guardians' temple|temple]] where the inactive Miraculouses were kept. It was also their duty distribute the Miraculous jewels to worthy people so they could benefit all of mankind and protect the world from danger which required them to travel all over the world. In picking those who were worthy, the guardians would perform a test and, depending on that test, if the person passes that means they were worthy of a Miraculous jewel. They also watch over the wielders they gave the jewels to, guide them if they need it, and receive the jewels back from them once the threat or danger is over. And yet, it's unknown when a guardian is done watching over one or more wielders if they continue traveling or return back to the temple. But when it came to those who were unworthy or wanted the jewels for evil purposes, it was their job to retrieve the Miraculous, sometimes even seeking help from wielders they've chosen to do so. Throughout history many guardians have trusted the jewels to many wielders, like the wielders that lived in Ancient China, the [[Ancient Egyptian Ladybug]], [[Hippolyta]], [[Tomoe Gozen]], [[Tentomushi]] and countless others. Even helping them tap into the jewels other powers like using them with Miraculous potions from the spellbook acessing seven different power up forms like the Aqua Mode or fusion forms. However, when Wang Fu was young, he made an unspecified mistake that resulted in the temple being destroyed, the [[Butterfly Miraculous]], [[Peacock Miraculous]], and [[Miraculous spellbook]] being lost as well. Wang took the remaining Miraculouses in the [[Miraculous jewelry box|box]], and he has kept watch over them and continued the duty of the guardians by himself since then. == System == Guardians are chosen as children to be trained for many years in order to be prepared for the task of watching over the Miraculouses. They are taught to understand the code in the Miraculous book, although Wang wasn't able to learn it completely before the book was lost. == List of members == {{GuardianList}} == Appearances == {{AppearancesS2|TC=f|SB=m}} {{AppearancesAMM|MF=m}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Orden der Hüter]] [[es:Orden de los Guardianes]] [[Category:Groups]]

{{Youmay|the ancestor of Armand D'Argencourt|the [[Darkblade|episode]] or the [[Armand D'Argencourt|akumatized villain]]}} {{Infobox_character |image = DB S01EP12 (306).png |caption = [[Armand D'Argencourt]] explaining Darkblade's backstory |only = [[Darkblade]] |gender = Male |full name = Darkblade |species = Human |occupation = Ruler of [[Paris]] (formerly) |residence = Medieval [[Paris]] |relatives = [[Armand D'Argencourt]] (descendant) |enemies = Unknown wealthy Frenchman |abilities = Swordsmanship |weapons = Sword |name = Darkblade}}{{Quote|To think that not so long ago, my ancestor's flag was waving above Paris...|[[Armand D'Argencourt]]|"[[Darkblade]]"}} '''Darkblade''' was a swordsman who lived in medieval [[Paris]], the ruler of Paris for a period of time, and the ancestor of [[Armand D'Argencourt]].
== History == During the medieval times, Darkblade took over Paris, ruling over it with an iron fist. However, later, a wealthy Frenchman won Paris' citizens over with underhanded means, overthrowing Darkblade and ending his reign.
== Abilities == Darkblade was a highly skilled swordsman. Due to his skill with the blade, he invented his own special technique, which involves pretending to be open for attack, just to suddenly fight back and knock his opponent's weapon away. As seen in Armand's explanation of him, Darkblade was also capable of using a lance and riding a horse.
== Sightings == {{AppearancesS1|DB = m}}
== Trivia == * After being [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]], Armand takes the name and appearance of his ancestor. * [[Nadja Chamack]] suspects that Darkblade's story is what motivated Armand to run in the election against [[André Bourgeois]], although Armand denies this.

{{Icons|Akumatized villain|Scarlet Akumatized Villain}} {{Youmay|the character|the [[Philippe Candeloro|actor]]}} {{Infobox character |name = Philippe |image = Philippe Square.png|Philippe Frozer Square.png|Frozer |gender = Male |species = Human |residence = [[Paris]], France |relatives = {{HideSpoiler|Luna, Maya, and Thalia (daughters)}} |supervillain identity = Frozer |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (fomerly) |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = Arin Hanson (English) |2 = [[Philippe Candeloro]] (French) |3 = Mckeidy Lisita (Brazilian Portuguese) |4 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:César Garduza|César Garduza]] (Latin American Spanish) |5 = Sa'ar Badishi (סער בדישי) (Hebrew) }} |first = [[Frozer]] |latest = [[The Puppeteer 2]] (pictured) |weapons = His ice skates (as a villain) |abilities = Ice Skating}} '''Philippe'''https://tvschedule.zap2it.com/overview.html?programSeriesId=SH02296324&tmsId=SH022963240000&from=sl&aid=gapzap is a figure skating trainer who appears in [[Season 2]] of ''[[Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir]]''. He is played by and based off of the figure skater, [[Philippe Candeloro]]. In "[[Frozer]]," after getting no one to register for his ice skating lessons, he is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Frozer''', an ice skating-themed [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].[[:File:MLS2 TFOU press 2017 - New Special guest stars.png|Image of the character]] == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Philippe is at a regular adult height, his hair is long and brown, and his eyes are brown. === Civilian attire === Philippe wears a white workout jacket, with a silver zipper and blue accents inside the collar along the forearms, and white sweatpants. He also wears black ice skates and a black necklace. He has a dangle earring in his right ear. === As Frozer === His skin is dark blue gradually turning to light blue and then white on his head, hands and feet. His hair is slicked up and back and his feet are huge, light blue and white ice skates. He also has a light blue snowflake symbol on his chest. His sclera and nose are light purple, and his pupils are turquoise. == Personality == Phillipe is a passionate ice skater. He regards his ice rink as his life and is enthusiastic on promoting his lessons. He can be persuasive when wanting something, such as when he tried to convince Santa Claus to have Christmas come early. Phillipe is also helpful at times like when he held off Christmaster's army while Ladybug, Cat Noir and Santa escape. As Frozer, he is determined to turn Paris into a city of ice and take [[Ladybug Miraculous|Ladybug]] and [[Cat Miraculous|Cat Noir]]'s Miraculous for Hawk Moth. He is incredibly confident and proud of his skating abilities, which eventually led to his downfall. == Abilities == === As a civilian === Philippe is very skilled at ice skating. === As Frozer === As Frozer, he can freeze entire cities with his ice skates. He also has the ability to shoot icicles out of his ice skates in midair. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|FZ=yes|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|CM=yes|PT2=p}} == Trivia == * His villain form is similar to the [https://megaman.wikia.com/wiki/Mega_Man_11 Mega Man 11] Robot Master [https://megaman.wikia.com/wiki/Tundra_Man Tundra Man] : ** Both are skilled figure skaters and incorporate their ice skating skills with ice manipulation to attack their opponents.  ** However, Frozer is human while Tundra Man is a robot.  * He was first revealed on August 31, 2017, in a teaser released by TFou. ** His villain form was later revealed on October 16, 2017 via an animated storyboard released by [[Thomas Astruc]].https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/900843948805148672 * Scarlet Frozer reappears in the two part special event "[[Heroes' Day]]". == Gallery == === [[Frozer]] === === [[Mayura (Heroes' Day - Part 2)|Mayura]] === MA (375).png MA (376).png MA (383).png MA (384).png MA (385).png === Concept art === Concept Ladybug skating.gif MLS2 TFOU press 2017 - New Special guest stars.png {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Philippe]] [[es:Philippe]] [[fr:Philippe]] [[pl:Philippe]] [[pt-br:Philippe]] [[ru:Филипп]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]] [[Category:Real world characters]]

{{Icons|Akumatized villain}} {{Infobox character |name = Boy |image = Sandboy Civilian Square.png|Civilian form Sandboy Square.png|Sandboy |gender = Male |species = Human |first = [[Sandboy]] |latest = [[Gamer 2.0]] |supervillain identity = Sandboy |residence = [[Paris]], France |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly) |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Casey Mongillo]] (English)https://twitter.com/CaseyTheVA/status/1044355510227456002 |2 = Clara Soares (French) |3 = [[:w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Luis Orozco|Luis Orozco]] (Latin American Spanish) |4 = Artur Salerno (Brazilian Portuguese) }}}} {{Quote|The Sandboy just checked in. Now, nightmares can begin.|Sandboy|"[[Sandboy]]"}} The '''boy''' is a child who appears in [[Season 2]] of ''[[Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir]]''.https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) In "[[Sandboy]]", after having a nightmare due to watching a scary movie alone by himself, he is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Sandboy''', a nightmare-themed [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].https://tvschedule.zap2it.com/overview.html?programSeriesId=SH02296324&tmsId=SH022963240000&from=sl&aid=gapzap == Appearance == === Physical appearance === The boy has black hair with blue reflections and dark blue eyes. He has fairly light skin, and his height is average for a child. === Civilian attire === He wears teal-and-white pajamas with [[Knightowl|Knightowl's]] logo in the center of it. He also wears socks with orange and white stripes. === As Sandboy === Sandboy is short with smaller proportions and has pale blue skin with white spots that resemble stars, purple eyes, and yellow eyebrows. He has purple hair with curled tips and an upward position with a glowing dotted line on each part, making the hair look like octopus tentacles. Over each eye, there is a yellow line. He wears a dark purple bodysuit with a large collar, the inner lining of which being yellow, and a nearly white glowing symbol on the chest. The villain also has lower arms which are thick with glowing dotted lines going down them. He also appears to be riding a dark purple item with cream-colored pointed tips that has resemblance to a pillow. == Personality == The boy is a happy boy. He is very energetic. He can be easily scared when something scares him, like in [[Sandboy]] when he watched a scary movie on TV and had a nightmare (which caused him to get akumatized). He was also very excitable when Ladybug offered to take him home. As Sandboy, he is more confident and demanding but at the same time as he was focused on Ladybug he left himself wide open. == Abilities == === As Sandboy === As Sandboy, he can cause the nightmares/bad dreams of others to be brought to reality by using multicolored sand that comes from his pillow cloud, which he uses as transportation. The sand is capable of going right through buildings to reach victims. He can also shoot the sand at his opponents from the cloud, and it will still have the same effects. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|SB=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|SW2=f|GM2=yes}} == Trivia == * Sandboy was first revealed in a promotional video for Season 2 from TFOU. * His supervillain name is based off the Sandman, a mythical character in Western and Northern European folklore who puts people to sleep and brings good dreams by sprinkling magical sand onto people as they sleep. ** However, his powers operate parallel to the Sandman's, as he brings nightmares to life as opposed to creating dreams. * He reports to seeing Hawk Moth while being akumatized, calling him a "weird man". ** As a result, he is aware that he is being akumatized, in a similar fashion to [[Caline Bustier]] in "Zombizou". * So far in the series, he is the first villain to see a [[Kwamis|kwami]] while akumatized and know what it is. ** He is also the second character in the franchise to be akumatized who does not have a given name, with the first being the [[Unnamed fisherman|fisherman]] from ''Miraculous Adventures'' #2. == {{Icons|Past Ladybug}} {{Youmay|an Aztec Ladybug|[[La Mariquita]], a girl during the Mexican colonial period, or another [[Ladybug (disambiguation)|Ladybug]]}} {{Infobox character |image = Micazoyolin_Drawing_by_Ferisae.jpg |caption = Drawing of Micazoyolin by [[Feri González]]. |gender = Male |species = Human |occupation = Warrior
Superhero |residence = Central Mexico |friends = [[Tikki]] |wieldedmiraculous = ladybug |abilities = [[Lucky Charm]]
[[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]] |weapons = [[Yo-yo]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was an Aztec warrior. He was a past [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]], wielding the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and transforming into a ladybug-themed superhero when [[Tikki]] inhabited it.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/921176781620760577 and https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/921180426001113089 == Appearance == Micazoyolin was muscular, and he had long black hair. Over his upper face, he had red face paint with a black bottom underline and three black dots on each cheek below. Red paint was also on his lower arms, and his body and upper arms were painted with black spots. He wore a headdress with a golden headband that had engraved details, red feathers that had black spots, green leaves, and ladybug stones/jewels on the band over each ear. His cape was dark red with black spots with golden edges. Underneath, there was a black garment that included a thin yellow stripe, a thin red stripe, and small green leaves on the edges. He also wore a thin golden armband on each upper arm, a thick golden wristband on each wrist, and a red skirt-like loincloth, which he wrapped and tied the [[yo-yo]] over. == Abilities == If this past Ladybug Miraculous holder had the same powers as the current Ladybug ([[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]]), he had enhanced abilities and the superpowers [[Lucky Charm]] and [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]]. He also had the yo-yo for a weapon. == Trivia == * [[Feri González]] revealed the character as her seventh Inktober drawing, noting that he was created by [[Thomas Astruc]]. * He is not the only known person of Mexican origin to wield the Ladybug Miraculous, preceding [[La Mariquita]]. * Micazoyolin's name comes from the Nahuatl word for "ladybug."[[wikipedia:nah:Micazayolli|Wikipedia:Micazoyolin]] * Micazoyolin, unlike most Ladybug Miraculous holders, was male, not female. {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[es:Micazoyolin]] [[pl:Micazoyolin]] [[Category:Deceased]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Former Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Ladybug Miraculous holders]]

{{Icons|Past Ladybug}} {{Youmay|a Ladybug in Vietnam|another [[Ladybug (disambiguation)|Ladybug]]}} {{Infobox_character |image = Bo_rua_Drawing_by_Ferisae.jpg |caption = Drawing of Bọ rùa by [[Feri González]]. |gender = Female |species = Human |occupation = Superhero |residence = Vietnam |friends = [[Tikki]] |wieldedmiraculous = ladybug |abilities = [[Lucky Charm]]
[[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]] |weapons = [[Yo-yo]]}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a Vietnamese girl. She was a past [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]], wielding the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and transforming into a ladybug-themed superhero when [[Tikki]] inhabited them.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/923334599303933953 == Appearance == Bọ rùa had long black hair and dark eyes.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/923697790324056064 She wore a white nón lá with a frontal design of a flying ladybug and flowers, and she wore the earrings. Her áo dài included a red tunic with black dots and black edges on the sleeves, collar, and flaps. The front flap of the tunic over the chest features designs of black curls connected to the black edges and a white flower button with a black center over it. Also, she wore black trousers and black shoes. == Personality == Bọ rùa is "nice and a bit shy."https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/923336022636793856 == Abilities == If this past Ladybug Miraculous holder had the same powers as the current Ladybug ([[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]]), she had enhanced abilities and the superpowers [[Lucky Charm]] and [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]]. She also had the [[Yo-yo|yo-yo]] for a weapon. == Trivia == * [[Feri González]] revealed the character as her eighth Inktober drawing, noting that she was created by [[Thomas Astruc]]. * ''Bọ rùa'' means "ladybug" in Vietnamese. {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[es:Bọ rùa]] [[Category:Deceased]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Ladybug Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Former Miraculous holders]]

{{Icons|Past Ladybug}} {{Youmay|a French musketeer Ladybug|other French Ladybug Miraculous holders, [[Jeanne d'Arc]] and [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]], or another [[Ladybug (disambiguation)|Ladybug]]}} {{Infobox character |image = La_Coccinelle.png |gender = Female |species = Human |occupation = Musketeer
Superhero |residence = France |friends = [[Tikki]] |wieldedmiraculous = ladybug |abilities = [[Lucky Charm]]
[[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]] |Miraculous Ladybug]] |weapons = [[Yo-yo]]
Rapier |only = [[Befana]] }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a French girl and a musketeer. She was a past [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]], wielding the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and transforming into a ladybug-themed superhero when [[Tikki]] inhabited it.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/923960909680087041 == Appearance == La Coccinelle had long dark hair, and blue eyes. She wore a brown cavalier hat with red feathers, and over her upper face, she wore a red mask. Her outfit included a red tabard that ended partially down her legs with black dots and black wavy edges on the bottom edge. Underneath the tabard, she had a white long sleeved shirt with a folded collar. She wore a black cloth corset over the tabard that had a black backside, and around her waist, she wore a belt with a black scabbard. The scabbard held La Coccinelle's silver rapier when she wasn't using it. She also wore black leggings, white gloves, and tan boots with white edges that started above her knees. == Abilities == If this past Ladybug Miraculous holder had the same powers as the [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|current Ladybug]], she had enhanced abilities and the superpowers [[Lucky Charm]] and [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]]. She also had the [[yo-yo]] for a weapon. Another weapon she used was a rapier, as seen in the image. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|BF=p}} == Trivia == * [[Feri González]] revealed the character as her ninth Inktober drawing, noting that she was created and designed by [[Thomas Astruc]]. * In French, ''la coccinelle'' means "the ladybug." * She is the second person of French origin to wield the Ladybug Miraculous, succeeding [[Jeanne d'Arc]] and preceding Marinette. * The image of La Coccinelle is based on the painting ''[https://gardenofpraise.com/artprint73.htm A Cavalier]''''' ''' by [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_Meissonier Jean-Louis Ernest Meissonier] , a 19th century Classicist painter and sculptor famous for his depictions of Napoleon, his armies and military themes. * Since she is a musketeer, it could mean that she was born some before or during the time of the Musketeers of the Guard. **  She is like Fuli from "The Lion Guard" tv series is the first known female to join the guard. == Gallery == ===Screenshots=== BF (41).png BF (42).png === Drawings === La_Coccinelle_by_Ferisae.jpg|Drawing of La Coccinelle by [[Feri González]]. {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[es:La Coccinelle]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Deceased]] [[Category:Former Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Ladybug Miraculous holders]]

With you, it's always unforgettable."|Gina and [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]]|"[[Befana]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}'''https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/924314078503407616 is [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]]'s Italian paternal grandmother and [[Tom Dupain]]'s mother.https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/924318581734760449 In "[[Befana]]", after she mistakenly concludes that [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]] no longer wants to spend time with her, Gina is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Befana''', a candy-themed [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].http://www.ouniversodatv.com/2017/10/gloob-estreia-novos-episodios-de.html#axzz4ukj8DxGxhttps://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/916768125131149313 (Twitter account managed by [https://twitter.com/dAFerisae Ferisae], a colorist for ZAG) == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Gina is at an average height with short silver (nearly white) hair and dark green eyes. === Civilian attire === On her head, she wears glasses with tan rims and long gold earrings with green circular tops. She wears a black leather jacket with an upward collar and silver flat studs on the shoulders. Her black shirt underneath includes a prism design, with light entering on side of a sphere and a ray of colors coming out of other side. She has black fingerless driving gloves with holes around the knuckles and on the back of her palm, a watch with a red strap on her right arm, and various bracelets on her left wrist: a gray studded bracelet, a gold band, and black band, and a rounded red band. Also, she wears red jeans, a black belt, and black shoes. When she is riding her motorcycle, she wears a red motorcycle helmet with black edges and gray comfort liner. === As Befana === Befana has bright red eyes, pale green skin, and long, brushed-back red hair with two white streaks. She wears a black mask with red edges on the sides of the face. Her outfit is a black short-sleeved bodysuit with jagged pink edges to the arm and leg sleeves, a large jagged pink-tipped collar above a regular black collar, and a pink and black bow resembling a wrapped candy on the chest. She wears black fingerless driving gloves that reveal long fingernails painted with red nail polish, spiked black cuffs, black shoes, and two thin black belts around her hips. One belt has a circular red-orange pouch attached to it, and it has a black symbol on it based on their bow. For a weapon, she holds a black gun-like object with a dark gray horn-like barrel, a jagged red stripe around the barrel, a blue rectangle on each side, and a semi-cube end of the handle with colorful objects inside. == Personality == [[File:BF (628).png|180px|right]] Gina is a very sweet, charming and caring person who deeply cares for her family, especially for her [[Tom Dupain|son]], her [[Sabine Cheng|daughter-in-law]] and her [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|granddaughter]]. She is also affectionate and understanding as she wanted Marinette to have a great birthday and to spend a lot of quality time with her too. Despite this, Gina can be forgetful and have a hard time adjusting to changes, as she didn't realize that Marinette was no longer a child and that she liked different things from when she was younger. Gina is a bit strict, energetic, adventurous, social, enthusiastic and quite ambitious person. According to Marinette and herself, she has been travelled around the world, including Patagonia, Australia, Balia and Estonia. She also has an Inuit friend. As Befana, she is more cruel, impatient and very demanding. She was ardent to render retribution to Marinette for not having rejected opportunities to invest time with her. She is additionally quite stubborn yet can be facetious, particularly when she begins singing her song to her victims. While aggressive and cruel, however, she still acknowledges and is pleased by acts of kindness and selflessness. She is also very prestigious when it comes to manners, even forcing Hawk Moth to ask nicely (much to his annoyance) before he can give her orders. == Abilities == === As a civilian === Gina is very experienced with riding her motorcycle. === As Befana === Befana can fly with the help of her transformed motorcycle. She can also either turn people into coal statues or to fairy minions via her pistol and order them to do her bidding. However, Befana apparently can not touch her own candies or she will turn into a coal statue as shown when Ladybug uses her candies against her. == Relationships == === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette Dupain-Cheng/Ladybug]] === Gina loves her granddaughter and visits her on her birthday in order to be able to spend some time with her. She has sent her letters from several places during her travels. However, Gina forgets that Marinette is no longer a child, mistakenly believing that she is turning 10 instead of 14, giving her candy that she no longer likes, and taking her to places more suitable for younger children. When Marinette asks her grandmother if she can go to the surprise party her friends are throwing for her, she allows this but is secretly sad, believing that Marinette is just making excuses in order to avoid spending time with her. As Befana, she angrily targets Marinette, calling her spoiled and believing that she needs to be punished. However, after being deakumatized, she understands that Marinette is growing up and offers to take her on one of her trips for her next birthday. Gina appreciates Ladybug's heroism, telling her and Cat Noir in "Mayura" that all the Parisians are on their side. As Befana, however, she doesn't like that Ladybug is trying to stop her. === [[Tom Dupain]] === Gina cares about her son but gets annoyed with him when he tries to tell her that Marinette is too old for some of the activities she plans on doing with her. When akumatized, she turns him into coal because of this. She even attends his 40th birthday === [[Sabine Cheng]] === Gina appreciates it when Sabine tries to comfort her after mistakenly believing that Marinette didn't want to spend time with her. Even as Befana, she acknowledges that Sabine has always been kind to her, deciding to turn her into a fairy instead of coal. == Family == {{Dupain-Cheng Tree}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|BF=yes|AS=f|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|BX=yes|GM2=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|PG=yes}} == Trivia == * Gina's akumatized form was first revealed at a press release held by TFOU.http://www.tf1pro.com/sites/default/files/atoms/files/miraculous_dossier_de_presse_saison2_low_def_tf1.pdf * While a Brazilian news article for Season 2 wrote that Befana is the grandmother's name, a crew member later confirmed that the name was not entirely correct. ** Befana is the name of an [[Wikipedia:Befana|Italian old woman]] who brings gifts to children on [[Wikipedia:Epiphany (holiday)|Epiphany Eve]] (January 5th), which is similar to Santa Claus on December 25th in other countries. * Gina's shirt's design is a reference to ''[[Wikipedia:Pink Floyd|Pink Floyd]]'s'' album, ''[[Wikipedia:The Dark Side of the Moon|The Dark Side of the Moon]]''. {{Gallery|image = BF (134).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Gina Dupain]] [[es:Gina Dupain]] [[fr:Gina Dupain]] [[pl:Gina Dupain]] [[pt-br:Gina Dupain]] [[ru:Джина Дюпэн]] [[Category:Parents]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]] [[Category:Members of Dupain-Cheng family]]

{{Icons|Past Ladybug}} {{Youmay|a Ladybug from feudal Japan|another [[Ladybug (disambiguation)|Ladybug]]}} {{Infobox character |image = Tentomushi Drawing by Ferisae.jpg |caption = Drawing of Tentomushi by [[Feri González]]. |species = Human |gender = Female |occupation = Kunoichi
Superhero |residence = Feudal Japan |friends = [[Tikki]] |wieldedmiraculous = ladybug |abilities = [[Lucky Charm]]
[[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]] |weapons = [[Yo-yo]]
Nekode }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' was a Japanese [[wikipedia:kunoichi|kunoichi]]. She was a past [[Miraculous holders|Miraculous holder]], wielding the [[Ladybug Miraculous]] and transforming into a ladybug-themed superhero when [[Tikki]] inhabited it.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/924664066047729669 == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Tentomushi had long dark hair, which she tied back into a ponytail, and dark eyes.https://twitter.com/dAFerisae/status/924665159779528706 === Civilian attire === She wore a [[wikipedia:haori|haori]] with stitching near the sleeve hems and [[wikipedia:hakama|hakama]], along with the Ladybug earrings. Underneath her haori, she wore a [[wikipedia:sarashi|sarashi]]. === As Tentomushi === She wore a red shinobi shōzoku with black dots and black edges around the jacket garment and belt. Her hooded cowl covered most of her face except her eyes. Over her upper arms, and over the front and backsides of her hands, she wore black bracelets, and on three fingers of her left hand, she had a nekode == Abilities == If this past Ladybug Miraculous holder had the same powers as the [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|current Ladybug]], she had enhanced abilities and the superpowers [[Lucky Charm]] and [[Miraculous Ladybug (superpower)|Miraculous Ladybug]]. She also had the [[yo-yo]] for a weapon. She also used nekode, as seen in a drawing. == Trivia == * [[Feri González]] revealed the character as her tenth Inktober drawing, noting that she was created by [[Thomas Astruc]]. * ''Tentomushi'' (天道虫) means "ladybug" in Japanese. * She is the first Miraculous holder seen with an additional weapon, her nekode, preceding [[La Coccinelle]] with a rapier and [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] with [[Kagami Tsurugi|Kagami]]'s saber in "[[Riposte]]". == Gallery == === Drawings === Tentomushi concept.png|Concept art of Tentomushi, by Feri. Tentomushi concept civilian.png|Concept art of Tentomushi's civilian self, also by Feri. Tentomushi Drawing by Ferisae.jpg {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[es:Tentomushi]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Superheroes]] [[Category:Deceased]] [[Category:Former Miraculous holders]] [[Category:Ladybug Miraculous holders]]

{{Icons|Akumatized villain|Scarlet Akumatized Villain}} {{Youmay|the ice cream vendor|another [[André (disambiguation)|André]]}} {{Infobox character |image = André Glacier Square.png|André Glaciator Square 2.png|Glaciator |gender = Male |species = Human |occupation = Ice cream vendor |residence = [[Paris]], France |first = [[Befana]] |latest = [[Mayura (Heroes' Day - Part 2)|Mayura]] |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Ezra Weisz]] (English) |2 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Damian Nuñez|Damian Nuñez]] (Latin American Spanish) |3 = Philippe Roullier (French) |4 = Henning Bormann (German)https://www.synchronkartei.de/serie/33761 }} |supervillain identity = Glaciator |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly) |aliases = Ice Cream ManIn "Mayura" by Ladybug. }}{{Quote|"Do you have anyone in particular to share your ice cream with these days?"
"Well, actually, I have yet to find the perfect blend of flavors."|[[Gina Dupain]] and André|"[[Befana]]"}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is an ice cream vendor who lives in [[Paris]]. In "[[Glaciator]]", after he fails to persuade Marinette to get another ice cream, he is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Glaciator''', an ice cream [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here]) == Appearance == === Physical appearance === André is stout, standing at a short height, with short brown hair and a brown mustache. === Civilian attire === He wears a short-sleeved white top with dark blue stripes, dark gray pants, and shoes. He also wears a dark blue beret on his head, a thin red scarf around his neck which he ties at the front, and a blue apron. === As Glaciator === He resembles a snowman made of ice cream, with a large, round head with an ice-cream-cone-shaped nose, a mouth made of multiple rock-like objects, red eyes, and a red cherry on top of his head. His body is white overall, with two more cherries down the front like buttons, as well as one on each knee. He has a dark brown coating on his upper body resembling fudge sauce, and his arms have round pink hands which have red rock-like things embedded in them. == Personality == André is friendly, jovial, and good-natured. He warmly talks with his customers, and he is enthusiastic about making ice cream. When his ice cream is ruined, although upsetting to him, he takes it as best he can, kindly thanking [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] for complimenting his ice cream despite him crashing into a container of ice cream and accidentally using [[Cataclysm]] on a serving he just prepared. He is a strong believer in the power of love, and he doesn't boast about how his ice cream brings couples together. As Glaciator, André is stern in proving to [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Marinette]] that his ice cream can bring people together as he retains his soft spot for couples, refusing to attack them.                             == Abilities == === As a civilian === André is experienced at making and decorating ice cream, using various flavors and presentations. He is also skilled in sales, knowing how to run his business and make a profit, along with being aware of good places to go with his ice cream cart and sell his ice cream to customers. === As Glaciator === He is able to transform people into ice cream. Over time, the people who are transformed into ice cream melt. He also shoots multiple scoops of ice cream from his hands and has amazing strength, being able to kick a car many yards away. == Relationships == === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] === André notices that Marinette seems sad when she visits his ice cream cart with her friends and attempts to cheer her up with some of his ice cream, telling her that if she eats it, her love will appear. Though Marinette insists that she doesn't have a love, André knows that this is not true. However, he becomes saddened when Marinette rejects his ice cream and denies that there is anything magical about it, leading to his akumatization. As Glaciator, he primarily targets Marinette, wanting to prove to her that his ice cream truly is the best. However, after being deakumatized, he bears no resentment towards her and happily gives her some ice cream the following day. === [[Adrien Agreste]] === André first encounters Adrien when he visits his ice cream cart and asks if his ice cream is truly magical. When André asks him what he thinks, Adrien replies that you have to believe, pleasing André, who then gives him some ice cream. === [[Ivan Bruel]] & [[Mylène Haprèle]] === Ivan and Mylène are typical customers of André. When he sees them visit his ice cream cart again, he calls them cute lovebirds. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|BF=yes|GT=yes|GL=yes|SP=yes|CA=yes|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|BX=back|TT=back|GM2=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|NO=yes|RO=yes}} === Comics and books === {{AppearancesMAdventures|IS2=back}} == Trivia == * On the Miraculous Amino app, Lindalee Rose posted an update about the upcoming San-Diego Comic Con 2017 panel for Miraculous. She noted that "nobody and nothing is safe from being akumatized," and she included an ice cream emotion, referencing Glaciator.http://aminoapps.com/page/miraculous/9312014/zag-comic-con-update * Glaciator's design was first revealed in a promotional video for Season 2 from TFOU. * André is one of the few akumatized villains who do not get an outfit change when akumatized. * Scarlet Glaciator reappears in the two-part special event "[[Heroes' Day]]". {{Gallery|image = GL (215).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:André]] [[es:André]] [[fr:André]] [[pl:André]] [[pt-br:André Glacier]] [[ru:Мороженщик Андре]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

{{Icons|Akumatized villain|Scarlet Akumatized Villain|Amokized villain}} {{Infobox character |image = August Square.png|August Gigantitan Square.png|Gigantitan |supervillain identity = Gigantitan |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly) |voiced by = {{Expand|1 = Caroline Combes (French) |2 = [[w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Tenyo Vargas|Tenyo Vargas]] (Latin American Spanish) |3 = Anni C. Salander (German) |4 = Joanna Pach-Żbikowska (Polish)}} |first = [[Befana]] |latest = [[Mayura (Heroes' Day - Part 2)|Mayura]] |gender = Male |species = Human |residence = [[Paris]], France |relatives = [[August's mother|His mother]] |likes = Sweets |aliases = Rugrat
Mega Baby
Little Guy
Big Baby
Supersize
{{HideSpoiler|Baby August}}}} {{Quote|Lollipop! Lollipop!|August|"[[Gigantitan]]"}} '''August''' is a baby boy who made his debut in "[[Befana]]". In "[[Gigantitan]]", after becoming upset, he is unintentionally [[Akumatization|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Gigantitan''', a giant [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]]. In "[[Miraculer]]," he is amokised by [[Nathalie Sancoeur|Mayura]] and his emotions form a Lollipop-themed [[Amokization|sentimonster]] in order to distract [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] from reaching [[Chloé Bourgeois]]. == Appearance == === Physical appearance === August is short and small, having dark brown skin, short dark brown hair, and neon green eyes. === Civilian attire === On his left wrist, August wears a gold bracelet. He wears a white and purple striped one-piece bodysuit along with plain white leggings and purple shoes. === As Gigantitan === Gigantitan's eyes are neon violet with black pupils and bright green sclera. He wears a purple mask that protects his entire head with a green object on his forehead and a pink mask covering his face. He also wears a purple one-piece bodysuit with pink sleeve cuffs and a green and purple colored bracelet on his left wrist. On the center of the bodysuit, is a logo which is mostly green with a magenta outline that has a picture of a pacifier on it. Gigantitan also wears pink and green ankle cuffs that are attached to his ankles, above his feet. == Personality == August is a very content, lively, and positive child. He likes to play around with objects and is for the most part well-behaved. However, according to his [[August's mother|mother]], he can be very stubborn. He has a tendency to cry if he loses his items important to him or doesn't get what he wants, and sometimes he doesn't immediately calm down, as is common for young children. Also adoring sweets, albeit too young to eat them yet, he is enthusiastic when he comes across them, and he wants them. He knows how to be polite, thanking [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] and [[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] when they return him to his mother. As Gigantitan, he is inquisitive, joyful, and bold. He likes to play with any object that he discovers, but he isn't very attentive to his surroundings, and when not able to discover anything to entertain himself, he gets upset and downhearted until he is satisfied by another object or distraction. Not old enough to know and understand many things, including common virtues, he often disobeys or misunderstands Hawk Moth's orders, and he doesn't have an issue sticking structures or humans in his mouth because he mistakes them for lollipops. == Abilities == === As Gigantitan === Due to his enormous strength and size, Gigantitan can easily pick up almost any object with a single hand, and he can throw them at a great distance. His weight and strength make it easy for him to destroy or crush objects, such as pulling the string of Ladybug's [[yo-yo]] and causing it to cut the [[Eiffel Tower]], and he travels distances faster when following or chasing other objects. == Family == {{August Tree}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|GT = yes|GL = back|BF = back|GZ = back|CA=yes|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|WD=yes|BW=back|MR=yes|GM2=yes}} {{AppearancesAMM|GF=yes}} == Trivia == * Gigantitan was first revealed in an email response from a Customer Service Representative from TF1 to the MLadyblogFrance Twitter fan account.https://twitter.com/MLadyblogFrance/status/931899488305930240 * Gigantitan is so far the youngest human villain to be akumatized by Hawk Moth. * He is unintentionally akumatized by Hawk Moth after [[Adrien's bodyguard]] suppresses his negative emotions in "Gigantitan". * Gigantitan is called "Babyzilla" in the German dub. * Scarlet Gigantitan reappears in the two-part special event "[[Heroes' Day]]".https://pandasuite.com/viewer/2.0.2/59a6c26e48abe6f53a002dc9?t=1 (direct video source [https://data.pandasuite.com/videos/59a3e7def643f27d7300131b-universal_1024_1024_20_main_3-0.mp4 here] and English subtitles [http://miraculousubs.tumblr.com/post/164947363272/the-careless-whisper-scene-at-the-end-really here]) ** Gigantitan also appears in [[Weredad]] and [[Gamer 2.0]]. {{Gallery|image=GT (398).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:August]] [[es:August]] [[fr:August]] [[ru:Август]] [[pt-br:August]] [[Category:Male Characters]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Children]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]

{{Infobox character |image = Albert Square.png|Normal Evil Albert Square.png|Akumatized |only = [[The Dark Owl]] |species = Computer |gender = Genderless |residence = [[Mr. Damocles' office]] |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly) |pronoun = He/Him |friends = [[Mr. Damocles]] |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = [[Ezra Weisz]] (English) |2 = Martial Le Minoux (French) |3 = Constantin Lücke (German) }}}} {{Quote|"Albert."
"At your service, sir."
"Hoo-hoo!"
"Please repeat. I was unable to understand."|[[Mr. Damocles]] and Albert|"[[The Dark Owl]]"}} '''Albert''' is [[Mr. Damocles]]' computer program assistant. In "[[The Dark Owl]]", when Mr. Damocles' [[List of akumatized objects|computer]] is infected by an [[akuma]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] and Mr. Damocles is [[Akumatization|akumatized]] because of it, Albert is akumatized along with him. == Appearance == === Normal === Albert takes the form of a circular, pixelated blue face on Mr. Damocles' computer screen. He has large, black circular eyes and a black handlebar mustache as well. === Akumatized === When he is akumatized, his face is distinctly more human, and he is now yellow instead of blue. He also has various computer monitor screens attached to cables that display his face. == Personality == As programmed, Albert is polite and obedient to Mr. Damocles. However, because he functions imperfectly, he gets confused by any command given to him or questions. When he is transformed by Mr. Damocles' akumatization, Albert is a lot more intelligent, functional, and helpful, following through on every request by Dark Owl. He also expresses horror when [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] manages to knock his computer screen off of the desk. == Abilities == === As a computer program === Mr. Damocles programmed Albert to activate the panel containing the Owl's suit, which Albert fails at because he doesn't recognize the code word "hoo-hoo." === As a villain === Albert controls most of Dark Owl's technology and traps, like his Owl-Signal, his holograms, and the shipping crate's trap door, from [[Mr. Damocles' office]]. He activates, deactivates or otherwise manipulates these objects on command. == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|TDO=yes}} == Trivia == * Albert's akumatized form is portrayed by [[Jun Violet]], one of ''[[Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug and Cat Noir|Miraculous]]'''''' '''co-directors.https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/938517845692092417 * He is a reference to [[wikipedia:Batman|Batman]]'s butler [[wikipedia:Alfred Pennyworth|Alfred Pennyworth]]. ** In-universe, Albert is named after and based on [[Knightowl]]'s personal butler, a character seen in the ''Knightowl'' comic books. {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Albert]] [[es:Albert]] [[pt-br:Albert]] [[ru:Альберт]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Genderless]] [[Category:Technology]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]]

{{Icons|Akumatized villain}} {{Infobox character |image = Anarka Couffaine Square.png|Anarka Captain Hardrock Square.png|Captain Hardrock |gender = Female |species = Human |supervillain identity = Captain Hardrock |alises = {{HideSpoiler|AnarkyBy Jagged in "Desperada"}} |residence = [[Paris]], France |relatives = [[Luka Couffaine]] (son)
[[Juleka Couffaine]] (daughter) |enemies = [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng|Ladybug]] (formerly)
[[Adrien Agreste|Cat Noir]] (formerly)
[[Roger Raincomprix]] (formerly) |first = [[Captain Hardrock]] |latest = [[Mayura (Heroes' Day - Part 2)|Mayura]] |likes = No rules
Messiness |voiced by = {{Expand |1 = Laura Préjean (French) |2 = Miriam Ficher (Brazil) |3 = [[:w:c:es.miraculousladybug:Gabriela Willer|Gabriela Willer]] (Latin American Spanish)}} |residence = [[Liberty]], [[Paris]], France}} {{Quote|We have no rules on The Liberty! Out of chaos comes creation! Messiness is life.|Anarka|"[[Captain Hardrock]]"|quotelink = yes}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is the mother of [[Luka Couffaine]] and [[Juleka Couffaine]].https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CtT7pI95GLNLz2xYT5gw1IHAFaB8O6n6cosXZVOK7N4/mobilebasic In "[[Captain Hardrock]]", after [[Roger Raincomprix]] bans her from playing in the National Music Festival, she is [[Akumatized villains|akumatized]] by [[Gabriel Agreste|Hawk Moth]] into '''Captain Hardrock''', a music pirate [[Akumatized villains|supervillain]].https://youtu.be/RebcChhKA9Q?t=205"[https://twitter.com/MiraculousMX/status/941128207738208256 …if their point was to prove that Captain Hardrock is Luka's akuma, I'll just laugh because they can not be MORE wrong xD (for starters, they aren't even the same gender hahaa)]"http://www.tf1pro.com/sites/default/files/atoms/files/miraculous_dossier_de_presse_saison2_low_def_tf1.pdf == Appearance == === Physical appearance === Anarka has long grayish-green hair braided down her back and sky blue eyes. === Civilian attire === She wears bright red glasses and a black coat with a gold trim that reaches her knees, over a light pink top and light blue jeans. She also wears heeled brown boots that go halfway up her calves. She wears earring with alternating aqua and red spheres, and a variety of bracelets and bangles. She also wears three rings on every finger except for her ring finger on her right hand. Anarka also has an indigo headband with a hair-clip positioned in the center. === As Captain Hardrock === Captain Hardrock has long red hair that is spiked upwards and golden eyes. The upper half of her face is covered with a black mark edged with dark red and she wears a black bandana with a white spiky-haired skull on the front, along with gold circular earrings. She wears a body suit that is red from the collar to the chest and black from the chest, the color separation looking like flames. The suit includes three yellow buttons vertically on the lower body, three golden spikes horizontally over each knee, and a golden patch above each hip. She has two black belts, one going around the body diagonally and the other wrapped around the waist, that have golden buckles. Over her suit, she wears a black captain jacket with golden inner lining, golden spikes on the shoulders, golden edges, and golden buckles on the sides. Black fingerless gloves with golden edges around the upper holes cover her arms up to her elbows. Her knee-high boots that end below the knees are black and red in a flame-like pattern with black soles, golden heels, black inner lining, and black stripes with golden spikes above the ankles. For a weapon, she carries a cutlass with a black handle, three thin red stripes on and near the pommel, and a blade with jagged black edges that goes from red at the handle to white at the tip. ==Personality== ===As Anarka === Anarka sounds and talks like a pirate as she believes that chaos and disorder can be a good thing, which is shown when she tells [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] that she likes to keep her houseboat messy. Despite this, she knows when they are not, such as not allowing a metallic statue anywhere near the boat's compass, knowing metal makes it goes crazy and thus useless. She also believes in freedom, even naming her houseboat “Liberty.” When [[Roger Raincomprix]] orders her to keep her music’s volume down, Anarka stands her ground as she believes that she should be free to be as loud as she wants for her concert. However, after she is deakumatized, she realizes that she should obey the rules sometimes and keeps her volume down. ===As Captain Hardrock === As Captain Hardrock, her desire for freedom increases to the point where she wants to blast her music across Paris and ruin the other concerts so that she’ll be the only one heard. When the passengers of her ship refuse to play music for her, she gets mad and imprisons them. She also doesn't consider herself as her kids' mom anymore and has no remorse in taking them prisoners when they refuse to obey her. == Relationships == {{SpoilerButton}} === [[Luka Couffaine]] and [[Juleka Couffaine]] === Not much is known about Anarka's relationship with her children, but she does seem to care about them. According to her, she doesn't allow them to clean up as they like the lived-in look and doesn't give them many rules. === [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] === When Anarka noticed Marinette cleaning her houseboat, she tells her not to as she likes the lived-in look. === [[Roger Raincomprix]] === Anarka becomes annoyed when Officer Roger tells her that she needs to keep her volume down and gets extremely angry when he gives her multiple tickets, causing her to get akumatized. However, after being deakumatized, she respects his request to play her music quieter. {{HideSpoiler| === [[Jagged Stone]] === It's revealed in "[[Desperada]]" that Anarka and Jagged used to play music together, but they got separated for some reason. After he let go his latest guitarist Vivica, Jagged tried to convince Anarka to play with him again, but she refused to do it. Even more, she got mad at Jagged for lying to her about his guitarist having abandoning him, when the truth was he was the one to fire her. Anarka let go her anger on Jagged after he apologized to Vivica and hired her back.}} == Abilities == === As Captain Hardrock === Her houseboat, the Liberty, has become a seemingly indestructible living ship that can fire chains on command to ensnare Captain Hardrock's foes, as well as blast lasers, and it's cannons fire cannonball-shaped speakers which seem to act as white noise machines. The compass also points to whatever direction Captain Hardrock orders. For a weapon, she has a microphone which doubles as a laser [[Wikipedia:Cutlass|cutlass]]. == Family == {{Couffaine Tree}} == Sightings == === Episodes === {{AppearancesS2|CH=yes|MA=yes}} {{AppearancesS3|DE=yes}} == Trivia == * Anarka's surname '''Couffaine''' is a combination of "couffin" (French for "coffin") and the French suffix "-aine" (meaning "of or from a place"), ultimately meaning "of/from the coffin". * According to [[Wilfried Pain]], Anarka is "the mother everyone wants, except when it's yours." * Anarka's akumatized form was first revealed when concept art of her ship was shown during a Nolife interview. ** Later, her appearance was revealed from a press conference by TFOU. * In response to a comment on Twitter, [[Thomas Astruc]] noted that, "in a way," Captain Hardrock is a reference to Captain Harlock from the manga series ''[[wikipedia:Space_Pirate_Captain_Harlock|Space Pirate Captain Harlock]]''.https://twitter.com/Thomas_Astruc/status/842506025928458241 ** Both Captain Hardrock and her ship are a visual pun on musical piracy. * It's unknown whether Anarka is married or a single mother. * All the Couffaine's names so far end with "-ka". ** However, it is actually a pun, as a matter of fact in French it sounds like "acouphène" which means "tinnitus". {{Gallery|image = CH (443).png}} {{Reflist}} {{Characters}} [[de:Anarka Couffaine]] [[es:Anarka Couffaine]] [[ru:Анарка Куффен]] [[pt-br:Anarka Couffaine]] [[Category:Female Characters]] [[Category:Parents]] [[Category:Adults]] [[Category:Akumatized villains]] [[Category:Minor Characters]] [[Category:Members of Couffaine family]] [[Category:Recurring Characters]]
